Dialogue/Extra/MuradinTaunt1.mp3.transcription: Oh, is that the best you can do?

Dialogue/Extra/MuradinTaunt2.mp3.transcription: I've met gnomes that are tougher than you.

Dialogue/Extra/UtherTaunt2.mp3.transcription: I am the hammer of justice.

Dialogue/GenericWarnings/GenericWarningG.transcription: A gold mine is running low.

Dialogue/GenericWarnings/GenericWarningU.transcription: A player's forces are under attack.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human01/H01Arthas.transcription: Can the formality, Zoother? I'm not king yet. It's good to see you.
Father still hopes your patience and experience might rub off on me.
Look, here's where we stand. Our scouts have confirmed that there is an orc encampment hidden somewhere over the next ridge.
It gets worse. They're preparing to attack the nearby village of Stronbrad. As far as we know, the village is completely defenseless.
Of course, Uther. Don't worry about me.
Damn. The attack has already begun. Two arms, my brothers!
Don't worry, son. We'll find them and bring them home safe.
Never a dull moment. Let's get moving!

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human01/H01Bandit.transcription: Take everything, man. Take all the valuables.
Heh, we'll take their coin just like everyone else's.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human01/H01Knight.transcription: Prince Arthas, Lord Uther needs you at the orc encampment immediately.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human01/H01Uther0.transcription: Welcome, Prince Arthas. The men and I are honored by your presence.
You too, lad. I'm pleased that King Terranus sent you to help me.
Well, it is a father's right to dream, isn't it?
I need to move against the orc's base immediately. Can you handle strongbrads' defense on your own?

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human01/H01Uther1.transcription: Good. Meet me at the orc camp once you've saved the village. Be careful, Arthas.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human01/H01Villag.transcription: But what about the others who were taken away?
Help! Help me please! I'm trapped in the cage!
Please get me out of here. I wanna go home.
Please, you're my only hope! A group of gnolls kidnapped my little Timmy and took him to their hideout in the forest. Could you find him and bring him home?
Oh, thanks so much. I have a reward for you.
Those bandits stole my ledger. Without it, I will lose my entire farm. Please, retrieve it from their camp. It would mean so much to us.
Help! Bandits are stealing our belongings!
We'll fight for Lordaeron! Get your swords!

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human01/H01WolfRi.transcription: All these wretches off with the rest of them.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human02/H02Arthas.transcription: Then let's get in there and destroy the beasts.
But what do you do over hunting in this region?
The fiery enchantments you seek could prove useful.
Let's bring this heart back to the dwarves.
I don't know, Uther. The orcs were sacrificing townsfolk. I think they were trying to summon demons.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human02/H02Bladem.transcription: Paladin Fool! The warlocks of the Black Rock Clan have spoken. Soon, demons will reign from the sky, and this wretched world will burn.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human02/H02Dwarf2.transcription: Now I will reform your weapons to strike with searing heat.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human02/H02DwarfH.transcription: Well met, good human. Have you come to join in our hunt?
The name of the beast where hunting is Cyrenox. With your aid, the monster won't stand a chance.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human02/H02DwarfS.transcription: We're hunting black dreaks. It's said that dreaks blood can be still fiery enchantments upon weapons.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human02/H02Footma.transcription: You sick bastards! You'll never get away with it!
If our town comes under attack, a militia can be summoned by ringing the bell on the town hall. The peasants will run to the town center and arm themselves for battle.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human02/H02Searin.transcription: You dare challenge me? You mortals become more reckless with every generation.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human02/H02Uther0.transcription: Ah, good timing lad. I sent two of my best knights into parlay with the orc leader. They should be returning shortly.
Damn, these orcs will never surrender.
Remember, Arthas, we are paladins. Vengeance cannot be a part of what we must do. If we allow our passions to turn to bloodlust, then we will become as vile as the orcs.
Now, if you're feeling up to it, I want you to lead the attack.
I'll remain here and ensure that none of the loathsome beasts threaten the camp.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human02/H02Uther1.transcription: Yes, I've heard this rhetoric before. You orcs will never learn!
It was only a mirror image. Damn it! What are these curves up to?

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human02/H02Uther2.transcription: You've done well, lad. This was a sound victory.
Have faith, lad. These orcs are trying to hold on to dying traditions. We defeated their demons a long time ago. Let's head for home. It's been a long day.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human02/H02Villag.transcription: Merlox, here? They must have an encampment nearby.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human02/H02Warloc.transcription: The hour of doom approaches. Let this paltry sacrifice appease our demon masters.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human02Interlude/.transcription: I told you before, I'm not interested in this nonsense.
You can show yourself now, Jaina. He's gone.
It's your inquisitive nature that I've come to rely on, child. That crazed fools convinced that the world is about to end.
It's a strong possibility. That's why I need you to travel there and investigate the matter. I've arranged for a special envoy to assist you.
I know you will, child. Farewell.
I'm sorry for eavesdropping, Master, but...
I've heard the rumors of the plague spreading throughout the Northlands. Do you truly believe that the plague is magical in nature?
Yes, Master. I'll do my best.
You must be wiser than the king. The end is near!
Then I've wasted my time here.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human03/H03Arthas.transcription: I'm sure. Jaina usually runs a little late.
Stay your blade, Captain. She can take care of herself.
Gentlemen, meet Miss Jaina Proudmoore, special agent to the Kirin Tor, and one of the most talented sorceresses in the land.
Looks like you haven't lost your touch. It's good to see you again, Jaina.
Yes, it has. Well, I guess we should get underway.
That could prove to be useful indeed.
This must be the shrine that the old man spoke of. Any man who drinks from these light-blessed waters will be healed.
We'll get to the bottom of this.
Could the grain itself be plagued?
What the hell are you men shooting at?
Well, I could use your help. We've got a warehouse to destroy at the end of town.
Let's study it after we kill it, okay?
What was that? And who was that wizard dressed in black?
Well, it's a good bet we'll find him, and the answers we're looking for in Andor Hall.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human03/H03Captai.transcription: Prince Office, we've been waiting here for hours. Are you sure this friend of yours is coming?

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human03/H03Dwarf2.transcription: We're blasting those damn skeletons, sir. This whole flaming village is crawling with them.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human03/H03Footma.transcription: Lock your shields and defend yourselves. Their arrows won't get through.
Undead, my lord. This whole village has gone mad. We did our best to defend the villagers, but...

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human03/H03Jaina0.transcription: "You too, Arthas. It's been a while since a prince escorted me anywhere."
Our sources believe the plague originated in the region north of here. We should check out the villages along the King's Road.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human03/H03Jaina1.transcription: It's as if the land around that greenery is... dying.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human03/H03Jaina2.transcription: Let's hope not. Those crates bear the regional seal of Andorhal, the distribution center for the northern burrows. If this grain can spread the plague, there's no telling how many villages might be affected.
As always, the generosity of the elves is greatly appreciated.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human03/H03Jaina3.transcription: That creature looks like it was sewn together from different corpses.
I believe that the roped man was a necromancer. Obviously he and his lackeys are behind this plague.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human03/H03KelThu.transcription: We've been discovered, my brothers. Flea and continue with the operation.
I'm sorry I can't stay in chat, but duty calls.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human03/H03Priest.transcription: Greetings. We are priests from Quelthalos. We've come to help heal the land of this strange curse.
You should know that there is a greenery warehouse at the far end of this village. This evil blight may be evident there as well.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human03/H03Villag.transcription: Prince Arthas, there's something amiss at the bridge ahead.
"Mallord, there is an ancient fountain shrine nearby. Legends say that its holy waters can restore health and heal grievous wounds."
"Millard, someone has destroyed the bridge from the far side of the river. There is another way to cross, but it is not as safe as it used to be."
"Millard, if this is about taxes, I can explain."

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human04/H04Acolyt.transcription: Damn these intruders! They must not interfere with the Master's plan!

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human04/H04Arthas.transcription: Let's not wait to find out. ATTACK!
Let's build a base camp here. With those cultists creeping around, I'd rather not head in there without backup.
"Jaina, I swear about a light. You shall be avenged."
What the hell are you saying? Who are you anyway?
I'll tell you all about it later.
All the granaries are empty. The shipments have already been sent out. Or too late.
This looks like some kind of gateway. I'll bet Jane it would know how to activate it.
Now a simple cult could have built this.
Are you responsible for this plague necromancer? Is this cult you're doing?
And what exactly is this scourge meant to cleanse?

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human04/H04Jaina0.transcription: Look, it's those cultists who are with the necromancer. What are they doing to that mine?

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human04/H04KelThu.transcription: "Hello again, children. I am Kel'thezad, and I've come to deliver a warning. Leave well enough alone. Your curiosity will be the death of you."
Yes, I ordered the cult of the dam to distribute the plagued grain. But the sole credit is not mine.
I serve the dreadlord, Malganis. He commands the scourge that will cleanse this land and establish a paradise of eternal darkness.
Why the living, of course, his plan is already in motion. Seek him out at Stratholm if you need further proof.
Naiiful, my death will make little difference in the long run. For now, the scurging of this land begins.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human05/H05Acolyt.transcription: Faster, my brethren. If we lose the shipment, the master will have our hides.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human05/H05Arthas.transcription: It looks like they're preparing for battle.
Damn it. Jaina, I'll stay here to protect the village. Go as quickly as you can and tell Lord Uther what's happened.
Wait, what did those crates contain?
The plague was never meant to simply kill my people. It was meant to turn them into the undead. Defend yourselves!
That caravan must be stopped before it reaches the outer villages.
I just pray that the grain hasn't reached any more villages.
Hold your ground. We are the chosen of the light. We shall not fall.
This is impossible. That numbers seem limitless.
"Ooh, sir! Your timing couldn't have been better."
Look, I did the best I could, Uther. If I'd had a legion of knights riding at my back, I would've
Then we should strike at their leader. I'll go to Strathome and kill Malganas myself if I have to.
Then feel free to tag along, Uther. I'm going with or without you.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human05/H05Footma.transcription: Prince Arthur's, during the night a vast army of undead warriors emerged and began attacking villages at random.
Just a grain shipment from Andorhaal. There's no need to worry, my lord. It's already been distributed amongst the villagers.
Prince Office, we spotted an undead caravan carrying a large load of plagued grain.
Prince Arthur's, the caravan, has infected the second village.
M'Lord, the third village has been infected!
Prince Arthur's, we fail to stop the caravan. It's reached the final town and turned it into an undead bastion!
Prince Office, the undead forces have arrived!
Ogres have moved down from the hills. It appears they're looking for a fight.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human05/H05Jaina0.transcription: Harthglen finally. I could use some rest.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human05/H05Uther2.transcription: Don't celebrate yet, son. This battle's far from over.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human05/H05Uther3.transcription: I'm surprised that you kept things together as long as you did, lad. If I hadn't arrived just then...
Now is not the time to be choking on pride. What we faced here was only the beginning. The undead ranks are bolstered every time one of our warriors falls in battle.
Easy lad. Brave as you are, you can't hope to defeat a man who commands the dead all by yourself.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human05Interlude/.transcription: I have no time for this.
Flee. My place is here and my only course is to defend my people.
Nothing he can say will make me abandon my homeland, Jaina. I don't care if that mad man has seen the future. Let's go.
I'm sorry for concealing myself, Arthas. I just wanted to...
I sense tremendous power about him, Arthas. Maybe he's right. Maybe he does know what will happen.
Greetings, young prince. We must talk.
Listen to me, boy. This land is lost. The shadow has already fallen, and nothing you do will deter it. If you truly wish to save your people, lead them across the sea to the west.
then your choice is already made. Just remember, the harder you strive to slay your enemies, the faster you'll deliver your people right into their hands.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human06/H06Arthas.transcription: Glad you could make it, Uther.
As if I could forget. Listen, Uther. There's something about the plague you should know.
Oh no. We're too late. These people have all been infected. They may look fine now, but it's just a matter of time before they turn into the undead.
This entire city must be purged.
Damnit, Uther. As your future king, I order you to purge this city.
Then I must consider this an act of treason.
Have I? Lord Uther, by my right of succession and the sovereignty of my crown, I hereby relieve you of your command and suspend your paladins from service.
It's done! Those of you who have the will to save this land follow me. The rest of you. Get out of my sight.
Father, forgive me for what I must do.
I won't allow it, Malgannis. Better that these people die by my hand than serve as your slaves in death.
We're going to finish this right now, Malganis. Just you and me.
I'll hunt you to the ends of the earth if I have to. Do you hear me? To the ends of the earth!

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human06/H06Jaina1.transcription: I'm sorry, Arthas. I can't watch you do this.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human06/H06MalGan.transcription: I've been waiting for you, young prince. I am malganis.
As you can see, your people are now mine. I will now turn this city household by household until the flame of life has been snuffed out forever.
Obviously, you are not as strong as the Dark Lord believed. Now, feel the wrath of the scourge as you drown under the flood of the living dead.
Brave words, unfortunately for you, it won't end here. Your journey has just begun, young prince.
Gather your forces and meet me in the arctic land of Northrend. It is there that we shall settle the score between us. It is there that your true destiny will unfold."

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human06/H06Necrom.transcription: Go sniff somewhere else, Pop. You'd best crawl back to your senile father and await the end of your reign.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human06/H06Uther0.transcription: Watch your tone with me, boy. You may be the prince, but I'm still your superior as a paladin.
How can you even consider that? There's got to be some other way.
You are not my king yet boy. Nor would I obey that command even if you were.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human06/H06Uther1.transcription: You've just crossed a terrible threshold, Arthas.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human06/H06Villag.transcription: What did we ever do to you?
You're supposed to be our prince!
You're supposed to be the Defender of Lordaeron.
The king's own men are attacking! Run for your lives!
The walls are falling in! Get out!
What have you done? What's going on?

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human06Interlude/.transcription: So much death. I can't believe Arthas could have done this.
He came to me before he left. I pleaded with him not to go. I told him it sounded like a trap.
Northrend. He's gone to Northrend to hunt Mulganis.
You! Arthas is only doing what he believes is right.
The dead in this land might lie still for the time being, but don't be fooled. Your young prince will find only death in the cold north.

commendable as that may be, his passions will be his undoing. It falls to you now, young sorceress. You must lead your people west to the ancient lands of Kalimdor. Only there can you combat the shadow and save this world from the flame.
Ah, Jaina, I thought I might find you here. Where has he gone, girl? Where has Arthas taken the fleet?
Damn that boy. I've got to inform King Tarenus. Don't be too hard on yourself, girl. You had nothing to do with this slaughter.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human07/H07Arthas.transcription: Captain, are all my forces accounted for.
Very well. Our first priority is to set up a base camp with proper defenses. There's no telling what's waiting for us out there in the shadows.
Ah, a gold mine. We'll set up our base there.
Murden? Murden Bronzebeard, is that you?
It's me, old friend. It's been a long time.
Rescue. Murden, I didn't even know you were here.
Of course I'll help Muradin. Let's move!
Let's move, men. Those dwarves need help.
Alright, Muradin. What were you doing up here anyway?
That has to be where Malgannus is hiding. I want that base leveled.
No matter. He can't hide from me forever. Captain, I want you to establish this site as our primary base.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human07/H07Captai.transcription: This is a light for second land, isn't it? You can barely even see the sun! This howling wind cuts to the bone and you're not even shaking! My lord, are you alright?
Nearly. There were only a few ships that

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human07/H07Knight.transcription: Prince Arthur's. We haven't found any trace of Malganis.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human07/H07Muradi.transcription: Bloody hell! You're not undead! You're all alive!
to harm boy. I never imagined that you'd be the one to come to our rescue.
Oh, just the same lad, I could use your help. My mates and I were attacked and we got separated. I'd appreciate any backup you could give me.
That's them! And they're still under attack from the undead!
Well lad, there's an ancient waygate that lies somewhere in this glacial wasteland. Supposedly, it transports you to a hidden vault where a rune blade named Frostmorn is held.
We came here to recover Frostmourne, but the closer we came to find in the way gate, the more undead we encountered.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human08/H08Arthas.transcription: Captain, why are the guards not at their posts?
"Oother had my troops recalled." "Damn it! If my warriors abandoned me, I'll never defeat Malganis." "The ships must be burned before the men reach the shore."
Burn down to their frames. No one goes home until our job here is done.
We'll need more men to fight our way through the undead.
Damn it, they're for forcing me to do this.
Very good, but there are still more ships to deal with.
Well done. Only one ship remains.
Quickly, my warriors. These murderous creatures have burned our ships and rubbed you of your way home. Slay them all in the name of Lordaeron.
Listen to me, all of you. There is no way home for any of us safe through victory. In this land, we will stand or fall together. Now, return to the base and man your posts.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human08/H08Captai.transcription: I apologize, Emissary, but the prince is away on an errand. What brings you to this desolate place?
Haha, were to just pick up and leave?
To hell with the undead. We'll cut our way through the woods, man.
Well, my lord, your father had our troops recalled at Lord Uther's request.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human08/H08Emissa.transcription: By royal edict, you men are to return to Lordaeron immediately. Lord Uther has convinced the king to recall this expedition.
That's correct. My men report that the roads from here to the shore are held by the undead. You'll need to find an alternate route back to your ships.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human08/H08Footma.transcription: Ah, we've done it lads! Let's board the ships and go home!
Our ships are ruined. What will we do now?

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human08/H08Muradi.transcription: Isn't that a bit much, lad?
I've come across a few mercenary camps up here. Perhaps we can hire a few of them.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human09/H09Arthas.transcription: Spare me, Mirden. You weren't there to see what Malgannus did to my homeland.
There's still one chance. Help me claim Frostmorn. If it's as powerful as you send, it might tilt the scales in our favor.
Captain, I'll leave you to organize our defense. Let's move out.
I doubt there's anything down here more terrifying than what we've faced already.
Still trying to protect this sword, are you?
I would gladly bear any curse to save my homeland.
Damn the men! Nothing shall prevent me from having my revenge, old friend. Not even you.
Now, I call out to the spirits of this place. I will give anything or pay any price, if only you will help me save my people.
Muradin is dead. But take heart, Captain. The enemy will not stand long against the might of Frostmourne.
You waste your breath, Malgannis. I heed only the voice of Frostmoor now.
He tells me that the time for my vengeance has come.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human09/H09Captai.transcription: Prince Arthas, where is Muradin? We can't hold out for much longer.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human09/H09Guardi.transcription: Turn back mortals. Death and darkness are all that await you in this forsaken vault.
Believe what you will, boy. You shall not pass.
Turn away before it's too late.
No, trying to protect you from it.

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human09/H09MalGan.transcription: The Dark Lord said you would come. This is where your journey ends, boy. Trapped and freezing at the roof of the world, with only death to sing the tale of your doom.
So, you've taken up Frostmourne at the expense of your comrades' lives, just as the Dark Lord said you would. You're stronger than I thought.
You hear the voice of the dark lord. He whispers to you through the blade you wield. What does he say, young human? What does the dark lord of the dead tell you now?
What? He can possibly mean to-

Dialogue/HumanCampaign/Human09/H09Muradi.transcription: You lied to your men and betrayed the mercenaries who fought for you. What's happening to you, Arthas? Is vengeance all that's important to you?
This looks bad. We're completely surrounded.
I have a bad feeling about this lad, but I promised I'd see this through.

Holad, there's an inscription on the desk. It's a warning. It says, "Whomsoever takes up this blade shall wield power eternal. Just as the blade runs flesh, so must power scar the spirit." Oh, I should have known. The blade is cursed. Let's get the hell out of here.
Oh, leave it be Arthas. Forget this business and lead your man home!

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human01x/A01Garith.transcription: You are late, Prince Kael'thas. I thought you elves prided yourselves on punctuality.
I am not interested in your fanciful excuses. You elves are here to serve the Alliance. Thus you will obey my commands to the letter. Is that clear?
Now, the undead have begun a new offensive to retake Dalaran. Their primary strike force marched south through Silverpine, but we managed to halt its advance at the base of the mountains.

We will be leaving immediately, but your people will be staying here. Our scouts report that a second strike force may be heading this way from the east. I need you to repair the outlying observatory so that we can monitor that region.
You have your orders, Prince Kael'thas. I trust your elven ears hurt them clearly enough. Move out!
I received ill news from the front line. Is it true that you've consorted with the vile naga?

They are inhuman and must be crushed like any other enemy. Be careful where you place your loyalties, blood elf. I will not tolerate treason in my ranks. Now I must return to the front. You will remain here and wait for further orders.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human01x/A01Kael02.transcription: It could not be helped, Lord Garathos. We ran into a group of night elves from across the sea, and...

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human01x/A01Kael06.transcription: My men are ready to fight my lord. When shall we leave for the front?

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human01x/A01Kael08.transcription: But, my Lord, we are warriors, not!

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human01x/A01Kael10.transcription: Insolent son of a... Let's get this over with.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human01x/A01Kael11.transcription: that gold mines in this area are nearly spent. We'll need to search the outlying region and find more resource nodes.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human01x/A01Kael12.transcription: Months ago, we buried a number of supply caches in this area. Perhaps it's time we dug them up. We'll need all the resources we can get our hands on.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human01x/A01Kael13.transcription: Ah, the hidden supplies! This will prove useful.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human01x/A01Kael14.transcription: Another supply cache. We'd best retrieve it quickly.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human01x/A01Kael16.transcription: Damn. We'll have to find a way across the lake to reach the outline goldmine.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human01x/A01Kael17.transcription: Naga, you fought for the demon Illidan.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human01x/A01Kael19.transcription: You have nothing I need, witch.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human01x/A01Kael21.transcription: And you would give these freely? Why should I trust you, my lady?

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human01x/A01Kael23.transcription: Then I accept your offer. Thank you.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human01x/A01Kael26.transcription: That's done it. The observatory has been repaired. Let's move quickly and get to work on the others.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human01x/A01Kael27.transcription: This observatory is repaired. We need to move on to the next one.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human01x/A01Kael30.transcription: Hail Lord Gelithos! The observatories have been repaired as you requested. We were just about to

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human01x/A01Kael32.transcription: Well, yes, my lord. They helped us cross the lake. I assure you, they pose no threat to us.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human01x/A01LadyVa.transcription: We are on our own now, good prince. I am called Lady Vash. My brethren and I come in peace to offer you our aid.
Is that so? I thought you might require bolts to reach the observatories you seek.
Our two races share a common ancestry care. Now, against the undead, we share a common peril. These boats are merely a gesture of good will.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human02x/A02Emissa.transcription: Greetings, Prince Kael! I bring word from Grand Marshal Garathos.
Apparently, the observatories you repaired detected a large undead force massing nearby. Lord Garathos has commanded that you crush the undead before they can march on Dalaran.
Unfortunately, your forces may be a little thinned. You see, Lord Garathos has also ordered that all foot soldiers, cavalry and support teams report to the front lines immediately. You men, move out!
The Grand Marshal has great confidence in your abilities. Be creative.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human02x/A02Kael06.transcription: This is preposterous. Am I to assault the undead with nothing but sticks and harsh language?

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human02x/A02Kael08.transcription: Garethos, I'm starting to hate that man.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human02x/A02Kael11.transcription: Those bases are lost. We'll just have to improvise.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human02x/A02Kael12.transcription: They've begun their attack. We must push them back!

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human02x/A02Kael14.transcription: Greetings, Lady Vash! I would welcome your aid gladly. But the commander I served does not approve of your kind.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human02x/A02Kael16.transcription: What you say is true, but I accept your offer, Vash.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human02x/A02Kael20.transcription: You have my thanks, lady. This victory would not have been possible without your aid, though I fear I may have doomed myself by accepting it.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human02x/A02Kael22.transcription: It is loyalty and duty that bind me to him, and to this failing alliance. But now those tenets seem as distant as our ruined homeland. All I know is that my brethren and I hunger for something more.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human02x/A02LadyVa.transcription: Isnudadya prince Kael. We've come to join your fight against the vile dead.
I do not see him here sharing your peril. Let me bolster your forces with my own. If not you and your brethren will surely fall.
Good. Let's get to it then.
The human you served trusts no race by his own. His sense of honor runs no deeper than his tolerance.
Then perhaps young kale, it is time to find a new path. To power and glory.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human02x/A02SpellB.transcription: Prince Kael, they've taken over our outlying bases. We're completely surrounded.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human02xInterlude/.transcription: So, Kale, you've shown your true colors at last. I knew you were in league with those serpents. Now I have all the proof I need to execute every traitor is one of you.
Save your breath. I never trusted you, vain, glorious elves. It was a mistake to accept you into the Alliance in the first place. Now, at long last you'll be dealt with appropriately. Take them away!
I can't explain it exactly, but ever since our homeland was destroyed, my brethren and I have felt empty, almost drained of our spirit.
There is a hunger now that has hardened our hearts.
We have been cut off from our power, from our birthright, without a new source of magic. My people will surely die.
You speak of madness, my lady. We will never be that desperate.
Damn, Vosh, you'd best leave. I cannot guarantee your people safety.
Please, my lord, spare my men. It was my decision to-
I know this hunger kale. Like us, your people are addicted to magic.
It flowed through your veins for over 10,000 years. And now, with a corruption of your land and the sun well that empowered you,
There are other founts of power in this world, Kael. Demons, for instance.
Your aversion is understandable. But still.
Prince Kale, Grand Marshal Garathos has arrived. He has brought a full battalion with him.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human03x/A03GuardO.transcription: It'll all be over soon, traitor. Lord Gerethos plans to execute the lot of you at dawn.
Don't worry. This prison was built by the Kirin Tor to keep their pets from getting loose. The elves' magic is useless inside those enchanted cells.
The blasted elves are free! We can't take them alone!

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human03x/A03GuardT.transcription: Sunrise can't get here fast enough. These elves give me the creeps.
We don't have to. We can loose these creatures on them.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human03x/A03Jailor.transcription: You've gone as far as you're going to go, Prince Cale. Make it easy on yourself.
It's a shame to see a good wizard gone bad. Do what you have to do, lad.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human03x/A03Kael01.transcription: How could I have let this happen to my brethren? Locked in these cells, our thirst for magic will devour us.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human03x/A03Kael06.transcription: On the contrary, Vash, your timing is impeccable. Once again, I am in your debt. But even if we free my brethren, there is nowhere to run. Garathos' forces outnumber us ten to one.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human03x/A03Kael10.transcription: Yes, I know it. The Litch Calfazade opened it to bring Archimonde here.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human03x/A03Kael12.transcription: side with a rogue demon or lead my people to their certain deaths. There is no choice here, Vash. We'll have to free my lieutenants first. They'll be able to rally the others while we assault the exit.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human03x/A03Kael17.transcription: That guard means to sound the alarm. Stop him!

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human03x/A03Kael18.transcription: If he trips the alarm, they will send an elite troops to stop us.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human03x/A03Kael19.transcription: Do not allow him to reach the alarm.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human03x/A03Kael20.transcription: Stop him before he sounds the alarm.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human03x/A03Kael21.transcription: The alarm's been sounded. Prepare yourselves!

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human03x/A03Kael22.transcription: The Elite Gods will be coming for us.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human03x/A03Kael24.transcription: Hmm. That switch on the other side of the wall will release the creatures upon the guards.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human03x/A03Kael35.transcription: The undead fled into these tunnels when we retook the city.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human03x/A03Kael43.transcription: You serve the Kirin Tor welcome. But the old order has passed away. My people and I are leaving this damn prison. One way or another.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human03x/A03Kael45.transcription: My brethren are assembled, Vash. Now all we need to do is reach this portal of yours and...

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human03x/A03Kael47.transcription: Then I will hold him at bay. I'll buy you all the time you'll need.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human03x/A03Kael48.transcription: I sense powerful spirits, stirring nearby.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human03x/A03Kael49.transcription: Arthas murdered a number of ark magi when the scourge ravaged this land. Now the wizards in visible spirits can find no rest. Perhaps we should track them down and give them peace.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human03x/A03LadyVa.transcription: Greetings, care. I assume we're not late.
You stand at a dangerous crossroads. You can either stay here and be slaughtered by human hands, or choose a darker path to freedom.
In the city above us stands a portal. A gateway that leads to other worlds.
Yes. My master Illidan awaits us on the other side of that portal. Lead your people to him, and he will forge you a new destiny. He will save your people's burning hunger.
Hold good prince. We need to keep the portal open long enough to usher everyone through. But Garathos' forces will likely attack it before we can make our escape.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human03x/A03Lieute.transcription: Prince Kale, we knew you'd come.
It's good to see you alive, my prince. What are your orders?

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human04x/A04BloodE.transcription: Prince Kaio, we've completed a new type of defense tower.
Prince Kael, the plans are complete for this new tower.
Prince Kael, this new tower is our final and ultimate creation.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human04x/A04Engine.transcription: Prince Kaio, the other engineers and I helped to build Dalaran's original defenses. We could salvage materials from these ruins and construct whatever defensive towers you need.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human04x/A04Garith.transcription: Blasted elves. I knew they'd try something like this. Forget about those damn towers. I want that portal destroyed. Those traders aren't going anywhere.
Use these explosives on the portal.
Whoever destroys the portal will be a hero!
Bust open the cages. We'll need all the beasts we can use.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human04x/A04Kael01.transcription: Quickly, my brethren, take your positions. Garethosis forces will be here any moment.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human04x/A04Kael03.transcription: Glad to hear it. You'd best get moving.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human04x/A04Kael07.transcription: Well done, Vash. If we build more strategic towers, we should be able to hold off Garethosis forces long enough for our people to get through.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human04x/A04Kael16.transcription: This artifact will help us greatly.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human04x/A04Kael17.transcription: I won't allow the humans to get their hands on this.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human04x/A04Kael18.transcription: I claim this for the Kirin Tor. The humans have no rights to it.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human04x/A04Kael32.transcription: Alright man, pull back! Back to the portal!

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human04x/A04LadyVa.transcription: We have reached the portal, Kale. Now we'll attempt to open it.
We've done it! The portal is open! Let the Exodus begin!
You better be right. If the portal falls, none of us will survive.
The portal is under attack, defended at all costs.
They're attacking the portal! It must be defended!
Care. Nearly half of our forces are through. You've got to hold Garethos at day.
Nearly everyone is through. Just a while longer and we'll have done it.
Kill! Everyone is through! Fall back and we'll close the portal behind us!
Now, young prince, we take one final step towards destiny.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human04xInterlude/.transcription: What is this desolate place, Vash?
Amazing. I remember when Cadgar led the Alliance Expedition here years ago. He almost succeeded in wiping the orcs out for good.
In an attempt to escape, Narsoul opened a number of massive dimensional gateways. But all they succeeded in doing was tearing the planet apart.
Illidan. Why here? What could possibly interest him in this barren wasteland?
Agreed. Actually, I'm anxious to meet him again. If he can cure my people of their hunger for magic, I will gladly pledge myself to his service.
This shattered world is called Outland, young prince. It is all that remains of Draenor, the former homeland of the orcish horde.
Yes. And now, amongst the ruins of this dead world, we have come to find the Master.
That I do not know. Regardless, we should seek him out quickly.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human05x/A05Akama1.transcription: I am a kama, elder sage of the draenei. Lord Illidan promised to rid us of our ancient enemies in exchange for our loyalty. These cursed orcs of Magtheridon, a terrible lord whose black citadel lies to the west. Under his command, the orcs hunted us to the brink of extinction. But now, with Lord Illidan behind us, we will fight back, and retake our ancestral lands.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human05x/A05Illida.transcription: Lady Varsh, your rescue was most timely. The thought of spending another 10,000 years in Mayev's prison was not a pleasant one.
Who are they, Vosh? The young elf looks familiar, but...

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human05x/A05Kael01.transcription: This place is unnerving. We've marched for three days and seen no signs of life. Still, I can't shake the feeling that we're not alone out here.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human05x/A05Kael16.transcription: The Warden Mayev swore to capture Illidan at any cost. She must have brought her warriors here to hunt him.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human05x/A05Kael17.transcription: There, Illidan lies chained in their cage, that night elves must be taking him to their stronghold.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human05x/A05Kael21.transcription: They've retaken the cage! We must get it back!

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human05x/A05Kael22.transcription: The cage is lost. We've got to follow them and reclaim it.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human05x/A05Kael23.transcription: They're getting away with Illidan! Move quickly, my warriors!

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human05x/A05Kael24.transcription: Illidan is unconscious, and this magical lock will take too long to open out here.
We'll have to bring the cage back to the Draenei village before we can free him.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human05x/A05Kael27.transcription: We've rescued Illidan, but we've got to get him to safety.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human05x/A05LadyVa.transcription: We aren't. I caught the scent just as the wind shifted.
We also serve Illidan, old one.
Night Elves, what could they be doing here?
Then we must rescue him before they reach safety.
There is still time-kill. If we move quickly, we can reclaim it before the night helps reach Sanctuary.
We could not forsake you, Lord Illidan. But you owe your freedom to them.
They call themselves the blood elves, my lord. They are the last mortal descendants of the highborn, who served you long ago.
This is Prince Kaelfas. He and his brethren have come to bask in your wisdom and pledge themselves to your will.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human05x/A05Maiev3.transcription: I grow tired of these games. Illidan will be mine.
Death to all who side with the betrayer.
Blood elves and Naga. Your bastard races are enough front to everything the night elves stand for.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human05xInterlude/.transcription: You will write to come to me, Kale. I share the pain of your addiction. Your hunger for magic.
There is no cure, young one. But there are ways to feed the hunger. Follow me and I will grant your people more magic than they can imagine.
Then arise, young Kale. You shall be my right hand, and the harbinger of my wrath.
Hmm. Many months after the Legion's defeat at the Battle of Mount Hyjal, I was visited by one of the last great Demon Lords. Kill Jaden.
What would you have me do? Great one.
It shall be done, great one. It shall be done.
At Doloron, I attempted to use the Eye of Sargeras to melt away the polar ice caps surrounding the Ice Crown Glacier. If the spell had succeeded, a Lich King would have been vanquished forever.

And the spell went awry. Given my failure, I fled to this desolate place to evade Kil'jaeden's wrath. Now, if I am to remain here in exile, we will need to ensure that Kil'jaeden's agents have been cleansed from the land.
Can you help us, Lord Illidan? Can you cure us?
So be it. Lord Illidan, my fellow blood elves and I humbly pledge ourselves to your service.

Illidan, in the past you have been both friend and foe to the Burning Legion. But by consuming the skull of Gul'dan, you sealed our defeat in this world. I come to offer you a second chance to serve us.

My creation, the Lich King, has betrayed me. He dared to break the pact that binds him to my will, but his spirit still lies trapped inside the frozen throne of Ice Crown. Destroy it for me, and I will grant you your heart's desire.
But the curse at night elves intervened.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human06x/A06Draene.transcription: Thank you, strangers. The wretched orcs nearly had us this time. If you seek to put an end to them, then our bravest warriors will assist you.
You saved our lives. We are yours to command Blood Elf.
O Dacama told us of your exploits, we will aid you in Lord Illidan's name.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human06x/A06Illida.transcription: Long ago, after Draenor's explosion, a brutal pit lord named Magtheridon rallied the surviving orcs and took control of Outland. Since then, his forces have grown strong.
by using the very portals that tore the planet apart. Many of Ner'zool's dimensional gates still stand, young prince. Magtheridon lure scores of hapless demons through them daily.
Yes. We will seek out each of the gates, and I will close them myself. Once they have been sealed, we will move against Magtheridon's Black Citadel, and claim Outland as our own.
Our forces must hold them back while we search for the dimensional gates.
I'll get to work on this gate. Kale, I will need you to defend me, just as before.
Kill. Cover me while I attempt to close this gate.
This gate must be sealed. I will need your protection, Kale.
Do not fear the demons, Kale. In time, they will call you master.
The final gateway is closing! Hold fast, my warriors! Our victory is at hand!
True. But his standing forces are still considerable. Assorting his black citadel will not be easy, Kale.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human06x/A06Kael02.transcription: How, Master? If most of the orcs were killed when this world exploded, how has he bolstered his ranks?

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human06x/A06Kael04.transcription: Then we must seal them permanently.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human06x/A06Kael06.transcription: Master Magtheridan must have discovered us. His orcs have already begun their assault.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human06x/A06Kael09.transcription: Lord Illidan is under attack! We must defend him!

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human06x/A06Kael11.transcription: Protect Lord Illidan at all costs.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human06x/A06Kael12.transcription: The Master is weakening! We must rush to aid him!

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human06x/A06Kael13.transcription: It's working. Illidan is closing the portal. We've got to buy him more time.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human06x/A06Kael17.transcription: The gate is closing! Fight on, my warriors!

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human06x/A06Kael18.transcription: The gate is collapsing! Defend Lord Illidan!

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human06x/A06Kael19.transcription: The gate is nearly closed. We must stand fast!

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human06x/A06Kael20.transcription: Be wary, Master. More demons are emerging from the gate.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human06x/A06Kael21.transcription: Magtheradin has called in his reinforcements.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human06x/A06Kael22.transcription: The gate is opening! More demons are charging through!

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human06x/A06Kael23.transcription: Mag Theridon's forces have besieged that Draenei village. If we drive them back, the Draenei will join us in our fight.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human06x/A06Kael27.transcription: Master, the final dimensional gate is surrounded by demons. We're going to have a serious fight on our hands.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human06x/A06Kael30.transcription: We've done it, Master. The dimensional gates are all sealed. There's no way for Magtherad into Kali reinforcements now.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human06x/A06Kael32.transcription: I wouldn't have it any other way.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human07x/A07Akama0.transcription: We draenei have fought the orcs and their demon masters for generations. Now at last we will end their curse forever. We are yours to command Lord Illidan.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human07x/A07Illida.transcription: Mac Therodin has grown strong over the years. But he has had few real foes to contend with. He has become decadent and complacent. The boisterous Kerr cannot match our cunning, or our will.
I am pleased by all people's zeal, Young Kale. Their spirits and powers have been honed in his harsh wilderness. Their courage alone may be enough to...
As I promised, your people shall have their vengeance acomma. By night's end we will all be drunk with it. But, Kale, give the final order to strike. The hour of wrath has come.
The nearby Bastion holds many of the orc's demonic siege weapons. We must crush the compound's defenders and claim the weapons for our own.
The Oxseeds machines are ours. We'll use Magthered in his own weapons against him.
Magtheridon stores his sky barges at the Bastion ahead. Those barges would allow us to assault the citadels' upper tears with impunity. We must claim them immediately.
The sky barges are ours. Now, onto the upper tiers, my warriors.
Victory is near! Outland shall be mine!
Strike them down! Show these tired wretches what true fear is.
Their time is done. Leave none alive.
*laughs* I have come to replace you. You're a relic, Magtheridon. A ghost of a past age. The future is mine. From this moment on, Outland and all of its denizens will bow to me.
Hear me now, you trembling mortals. I am your lord and master. Illidan reigns supreme.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human07x/A07Kael04.transcription: This will be a glorious battle master. Though Magtheridon's force is vastly outnumber ours, your warriors are prepared to fight to the end.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human07x/A07Kael15.transcription: Is that all you've got demons? Is that all the power you can muster?

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human07x/A07Kael16.transcription: Taste the vengeance of the blood elves!

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human07x/A07Kael17.transcription: Fight on my brethren! Slade them all in a master's name!

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human07x/A07LadyVa.transcription: Lord Illidan, new arrivals come to greet you.
We've broken through their first line of defenders. Strike hard, you warriors. Victory to Lord Illidan!
These weaklings cannot stop us! Onward to the summit!
You've done it, Lord Illidan! The defenses are broken! Only Magtheridon and his lackeys stand before us!

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human07x/A07Magthe.transcription: These upstarts are tiresome gnats, nothing more. The might of Magtheridon cannot be denied. I am the lord of Outland. Those who dispute my rule will soon regret their folly.
I do not know you, stranger, but your power is vast. Are you an agent of the Legion? Have you been sent to test me?

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human07x/A07OrcWar.transcription: Our enemies draw near Lord Meg Theradon.

Dialogue/HumanExpCamp/Human07xInterlude/.transcription: Kil'Taeden, I was merely set back. I was attempting to bolster my forces. The Lich King will be destroyed. I promise you.
Perhaps hiding here was not the most prudent decision. Still, the quest lies before us. Will you follow me into the cold heart of death itself?
What is this, Varsh? Where did this storm come from?
The blood elves are yours as well, Master. We will drive the scourge before us and shatter the frozen throne as you command.
Foolish little mongrel. You fail to destroy the frozen throne as I commanded. And still you thought to hide from me in this forsaken backwater. I thought you to be more cunning, Illidan.
Still, these servitors you've gathered show some promise. I will give you one last chance, Illidan. Destroy the Frozen Throne, or face my eternal wrath.
Keep a head down, fool! Something terrible is drawing near!
The Naga are yours to command Lord Illidan. Where you go, we follow.

Dialogue/NightElfCampaign/NightElf01/N01.transcription: Helen save us. The dead advance in waves.
[Laughter]
Ah! We shouldn't even be here! Those siding with the orcs.
They must have followed us from load her on.

We are preparing to leave this place, Priestess. There is a terrible evil corrupting these lands, and I will not allow it to consume my people. Unfortunately, we cannot leave until the rest of our tribe has been accounted for.
Thank you, Priestess. We will reward you when you return.
Many thanks, Priestess. Now we can evacuate the village. Please accept the aid of our champion. He will protect your life with his own.
We're here to hunt the remaining demons, human. Your luckier goals are the same.
It's the undead! Defend yourselves!
Put your backs into it! Jaina and the Arc War Chief expect this base to be built swiftly.
Alright, you men. Mind your business. Back to work.
Pardon, Priestess. But you've been staring out across Ashenvale for hours.
The green scans who killed Sonarius?
I sense something dark stirring within the forest chondrous. It feels as if it's heading this way.
Perhaps, perhaps something more.
So, these orcs and humans presume to run rampant through our lands? They will regret ever stepping foot into Ashenvale. We will establish a base and deal with these outlanders as they deserve.
How dare you call us demons. It is you, Mongrels, who threatened this land.
You outlanders will answer for Sennarius' death. Anaduna Thera!
What is happening here, old one?
Do not fear, old one. I will find your tribesmen and lead them back to you.
Those must be the lost furbolks. I must lead them back to their village.
Your offer is a generous one. May alone light your path to safety.
The tree of life is the heart of our might elf villages. Use the tree's ability to entangle the gold mine. After entangling the mine, send wisps in to extract gold.
The moon wells are the source of our nourishment and strength. You can build additional moon wells to nourish more troops.
to train more troops, construct an ancient of war.
Wisps are friendly spirits that harvest gold and lumber for our villages. They also create the structures that allow us to train more warriors.
Bandu Thorebas Mortals, you will pay for defiling these lands.
I am the justice of Elune. The goddess's wrath is infallible.
Quickly, my sisters. Back to the trees. We are no match for a force this fast.

Dialogue/NightElfCampaign/NightElf02/N02.transcription: The undead are tireless. There's no way to outrun them.
Thundoodath Balaure
Aluna Dore Priestess, we are yours to command.
"Aloon adore, priestess." "Be wary. The Doom guards command shades that can see us, even when we milled with the shadows. We'd best stay away from them."
Hahaha. Legion has returned to consume this world woman. And this time, your troublesome race will not stop us.
Fools, you let us slip away!
Find her, damn you! Find her and kill her.
These damn night elves cannot escape us. Norakaman wants them found.
Lord Archimonde wishes us to corrupt this forest, and we shall...
The trees must be poisoned and cursed. Only then will the Nidal's power weaken.
Silly Night Elf, you cannot hide from us!
Your shadow powers will not hide you from our sight.
I see you, little one. You should have fled with your sisters.
Ambush! Run for your lives! We'll regroup in the clearing ahead!
There is danger ahead, Priestess. You must proceed with caution.
Be careful, priestess. These woods are overrun by the dead.
"Terranda, praise the loon you've made it." The undead appeared out of nowhere and attacked our village without warning.
You see, Lord Archimonde, we do not fear the night elves. The scourge can...
A gimonde. After 10,000 years, how is it possible?
The day we have long feared has finally come. The Burning Legion has returned. I must cross the river and warn the rest of my sisters before all is lost.
I must avoid being seen.
Clearly the humans have no love for the undead, but I dare not trust them.
Foul humans. You cannot evade the goddess's wrath.
Ishinwala, sisters. It is I, Tyranda.
Those orcs appear to be guarding some magical treasure. Hmm. It might prove useful to me.
I must reach the river before the dawn breaks. I cannot remain hidden during the day.
The Dawn has come. I can no longer rely upon Elune's power to keep me hidden.
Ah, these abandoned ballistas will help me break through the undead fortifications.
Yishn-dadi-aushandras, we have a greater problem. The undead were sent here by the Burning Legion, our ancient enemies of old. Against such might we have only one option. We must awaken the druids.

Dialogue/NightElfCampaign/NightElf03/N03.transcription: But Priestess, the orcs have established a crude settlement upon the Isle. We'll need to fight our way through them to reach Tsunarius' horn.
Priestess the undead drawn near the Barrow Den. Shando Stormrage will be defenseless.
Priestess the undead have nearly reached the Barrow Den, you must hurry and recover the horn.
Priestess, the undead have surged forward. The Baroden has fallen.
The horn has sounded, and I have come, as promised. I smell the stench of decay and corruption in our land. That angers me greatly.
Come forth, you defenders of old! Crush these invaders, as you did in ages past!
These elves are stronger than we thought!
No tarot god, for what you throw!
Priestess Tyrande, thank Elune we found you. The undead are advancing upon the nearby Barrow dens. The dens seem abandoned, but
Then we'd better hurry, if the undead overtake his den before he's awakened.
With Sonarius dead, it falls to us to awaken the druids. We must recover the demigods horn from the sacred moonblade isle. Only its clarion call can awaken the druids from their slumber.
There is one druid sleeping within them, Sister, Furion Stormrage. He is the wisest and most powerful of all the druids. He must be warned that the Legion has returned.
Let us make haste, my sisters. All our hopes rest on Furian's Awakening.
Furion, my love. I wasn't fast enough to save you. I have failed us all.
At last, the Horn of Cenarius. Now we can awaken Furion.
Strike fast and snare them all before they regroup.

Dialogue/NightElfCampaign/NightElf04/N04.transcription: We are yours to command Shando Stormrage.
That did it boys! We've driven them off! Let's regroup back at the base and tend to our wounded.
It has been a thousand years since I last looked upon you, Tyrande. I thought of you every moment I roamed through the Emerald Dream.
In the dream, I felt our land being corrupted, just as if it were my own body. You were right to awaken me.
as was foretold.
No doubt Archimonde will make his way to Hyjal Summit and attack the world tree. If he succeeds in draining the tree's energies, this world will be doomed.
So, the Outlanders battle against the undead as well. They could prove to be powerful allies against Archimonde and his ilk.
Perhaps you are right, my love. We will establish our new settlement here. Keep your centuries alert. I doubt that we have seen the last of the Outlanders or the undead.
Perhaps they did not escape the corruption after all.
I've never seen the creature so aggressive before.
You've changed, Tyrande. There is little mercy left in you.
If your endless vigil has hardened you, my love, it must be part of your goddess's plan.
Pathetic wretches. That pains me that you once called yourselves Night Elves.
Come forth druids of the Talon. Let the Stormcrows fly once again upon the winds of war.
Isnu Allah, my brethren, Kalimdor has need of your powers once again, but the hour of doom is at hand.
Now we must delve into the earth and rouse the ferocious druids of the claw from their slumber.
Come no further weakling. Lord Ticondry has commanded us to kill anyone attempting to enter this place. And we shall...
My heart rejoices to see you again, Furion. But I would not have awakened you unless the need was urgent.
The Burning Legion has returned, Furion. Scenarius is dead. And Outlanders roam freely through our most sacred veils.

My only thought was to awaken you and the rest of the druids. The druids of the Talon reside within the Barrow dens at the end of this valley. If we can reach them we may have a chance to stop Archimonde and his demons.
Our resources are depleting fast. We must find another gold mine and muster our forces. Only then will we be able to reach the Barrow Dense.
No, the outpost has been corrupted and the Trians have been driven mad. They do not deserve this cruel fate.
They are Mongrels and nothing more. They are responsible for Sonarius' death. I will be damned before I stand with them.
Wait, I know those fur bogs. They escaped from Ashenvale when the corruption started to spread.
Then I will put an end to their curse.
Long ago I swore to protect this land, Furion. I never had the luxury of sleeping through times of great peril.
Hopefully the land will heal itself of this cursed blight. We should get moving. The Barrow dens lie within the valley just ahead of us.

Dialogue/NightElfCampaign/NightElf05/N05.transcription: Shandor Stormrage. I don't know what came over us. It's been so long since we remembered who we were.
Then we droage of the Claw, yours to command Shando Stormbridge.
"Hold, Priestess! We need your help!" Our shaman was bitten by a strange spider and has become deathly ill. Our tribesmen have run off, leaving us to fend for ourselves.
The waters of the nearby fountain of life can save him, but we dare not leave him in this state. If you can fill this vial with its waters and return it to us, our shaman's life will be saved.
Alone be praised, priestess. Truthfully, we doubted that you'd return. Now our shaman has a chance.
"Again, I must thank you for your help. Take this talisman. Should you require our aid, it will summon us to fight at your side."
These barrow deeps have remained untouched for nearly 3,000 years. Still, there's no telling what creatures may have taken up residence after we seal these tunnels shut.
Agreed. Just be careful. There is no telling how the druids of the Claw will react to us after all this time.
These cave spiders are enormous.
If the corruption can do this to these simple creatures, I dare not imagine what it could do to the beasts who live above.
Oh no. How could I have forgotten?
This door leads to Illidan's prison, Tyrande. We should go now.
No, Tyrande. That beast must never be set free.
Be that as it may. He is far too dangerous. I forbid it.
My powers cannot open the door. Though it grieves me to leave her, I must press on.
Let me pass." The arc druid of the moon-glade demands passage.
Fowl's spawn of Deathwing. I should have known that you loathsome beasts would take refuge within the flames of the earth.
Bear Gods.
Perhaps the creature was referring to the sleeping druids of the claw. But why would he call them Bear Gods when they appear as I do?
Ah, the droods of the claw are awake already. Come, my brothers, we have much to do.
What in them? They've lost themselves to their animal aspects. They're mindless and feral.
The horns call might work, but it would reach only a few of them in this part of the cavern.
All is well, Theroshan. I have neither of you and your mighty brethren once again. After these many ages, the Burning Legion has returned, and only our combined strength can drive them back.
Illidan. You were sentenced to pay for your sins. Nothing more.
Have you even considered the cost, Tyrande? This betrayer's aid may doom us all before the end. I will have nothing to do with this.
Duranda, it is your voice. After all these ages spent in darkness, your voice is like the pure light of the moon upon my mind.
Because I once cared for you, Tyrande, I will hunt down the demons. But I will never owe our people anything.
It has been an eternity, brother. An eternity spent in darkness.
And who were you to judge me? We fought the demons side by side, if you recall.
Hold Priestess. This place is forbidden, even to one such as you. There is a terrible evil here that must remain chained beneath the earth.
Madness! You would doom us all by freeing the betrayer!
Turn back! You are unworthy to bask in the Bear God's presence.
There is nothing to fear in this place. The only enemy that has ever given me pause is now corrupting the lands above us. Let us be done with this business and get back to the surface.
I sense a strange darkness tainting them. They have been transformed by a great evil.
Demon pile. This must be what cursed the spiders.
We must put an end to this corruption. No matter the cost.
What would you have us do?
If his wisdom will prevent you from turning feral like your tribesmen, I will gladly save your shaman.
This must be the fountain of life. I need only place the vial in the fountain's waters.
The pathway cuts off to the south. But this doorway looks promising.
What is behind this door that worries you, my love?
Illidan. It's been 10,000 years. Could he still be alive? We should free him, Furion. He would be the perfect ally against the undead and their demon masters.
But he is your brother.
Only the goddess may forbid me anything. I will free Illidan whether you like it or not.
I cannot go back. Got a scrant that Furion was wrong.
A cache of the watchers' weapons. These should help us considerably.
These explosive devices look to be of goblin design. The wily creatures must have hidden them here long ago. No matter. I'll make good use of them.
The Trians moved to block my path. Only a powerful druid could command such creatures.
Iledan was considered a great hero once. I believe he will become one again.
Iledan, is that you?
The Legion has returned, Illidan. Your people have need of you once more.
Then let us hurry back to the surface. The demon's corruption spreads with every second we waste.
Furion
Enough of this, both of you. What is done is done. My love. With Illidan's help, we will drive the demons back once again and save what is left of our beloved land.
Your quest is foolhardy. Even your goddess has condemned the one you seek to free.
Death to the intruders.

Dialogue/NightElfCampaign/NightElf06/N06.transcription: Are you certain of that demon hunter? Are you certain your will is your own?
Come then, you'll find that we're evenly matched.
The Dreadlord who commands this undead army is called Ticondrius. He controls a powerful warlock artifact called the Skull of Gul'dan.
It is responsible for corrupting these forests.
Let's just say that I have no love for Ticondrius, and the Lord I serve would benefit from the Legion's downfall.
My master sees all, Demon Hunter. He knows that you've sought power your whole life. Now it lies within your grasp. Seize it, and your enemies will be undone.
Foul demon. What have you done with my brother?
At the cost of your soul, you are no brother of mine. Be gone from this place, and never set foot in our lands again.
I am free after 10,000 years. Yet still my own brother thinks I am a villain. I'll show him my true power. I'll show him that the demons have no hold over me.
You're weak of death, human. You regret approaching me.
We could go on fighting like this. Forever. What is it you truly want?
And you wish for me to steal it. Why?
Why should I believe anything you say, little human?
That is where the skull of Gul'dan is kept. These paltry demons will not prevent me from claiming it.
Now, at least the demons will no longer corrupt the forests. But, if I destroy the skull and claim its powers as my own, I will become stronger than any of Archimonde's lieutenants.
Yes, the power should be mine.
*laughing* Now I am complete.
Let's see how confident you are against one of your own kinds, Greg Lord.
It is I, Purim. This is what I've become.
The leader of the undead has been destroyed, and the forest will heal, in time.
So be it, brother.
I'm through toying with you, Night Elf. Be gone from my sight.
Who are you?
No. Illidan, how could you?

Dialogue/NightElfCampaign/NightElf06Inte.transcription: Last night in a dream, a great raven spoke to me and summoned me to this place.
It was you in my dream. But who were you to make such an offer to us?
And I am Jaina Proudmore, leader of the human survivors of Lordaeron.
Peace, Priestess. They've come to aid you against the Legion.
I am the reason for the Legion's return.
Years ago, I brought the orcs into this world, and by doing so, I opened a path for the demons as well.
For my sins, I was murdered by those who I cared for most.
Despite my death, war raged across the lands of the East for many long years, leaving entire kingdoms devastated in its wake.
Now, at long last I have returned to set things right. I am the div, the last guardian. I tell you now, the only chance for this world is for you to unite in arms against the enemies of all who live.
We were summoned here as well.
I am Thrall, son of Duraltan, Warchief of the Horde.
We have no time for this, Furion. What are we doing out here?

Dialogue/NightElfCampaign/NightElf07/N07.transcription: Hear me, Night Elves. The time for reckoning has come.
You orcs are weak and hardly worth the effort. I wonder why Maneroth even bothered with you.
The rich and little Willpax really hurt me. Are there none left to stand against the Legion?
You are very brave to stand against me, little human. If only your countrymen had been as bold, I would have had more fun scouring your wretched nations from the world.
Stormrage! Show yourself! Or do you intend to have mortal girls do all your fighting for you?
Come unite elves! Where is the fire and the passion with which you fought so long ago?
This is almost too easy. If I had known that this mortal resistance would be so weak, I would have launched this invasion centuries ago.
At last, the way to the world tree is clear. Witness the end, you mortals. The final hour has come.
Ten thousand years ago, we night elves defeated the Burning Legion. Though the rest of the world was shattered, we were left free to live out our immortal lives in peace, bound to the world tree.
We are its protectors, and through it we were granted immortality and power over nature. Now, at last, it is time we gave that power back.
If pride gives us pause, my love, then perhaps we have lived long enough already. I will proceed to the summit and prepare our defenses there. Whatever comes, my love. Remember, our bond is eternal.
Yes. Now our victory is assured.
Archimonde's victory here has made him overconfident. He will not see the trap that I laid for him until it is too late.
To arms, my brethren. To arms, brave orcs and humans. Twilight falls, and the enemy awaits.
Priestess the undead have constructed a new settlement. They are mustering new forces to send at us.
Priestess the undead have constructed a final settlement. They are mustering new forces with every passing moment.
I'm sorry I'm late. It's just as we feared. Archimonde and his doomguard are making their way towards the summit. He'll be here any moment.
If you can provide our bases with support and keep us from being overwhelmed, Thrall and I will delay Archimonde's ascent.
The undead have breached our defenses, we need help immediately.
The undead are attacking send help.
We're getting swamped here, we could use some backup.
Is talking all you demons do?
Priestess Turanda. The undead have begun to construct a new settlement. It won't be long before they start attacking our allies.
We're under attack! Send reinforcements quickly!
We need hope immediately.
Fight on, my warriors! They cannot stop the horde!
Our spirit is stronger than you know, demon. If we are to fall, then so be it. At least now, we are free.
You realize that we will age as these mortals do. Our powers over nature will wane in time.
Your plan is a bold one, girl. Perhaps I have misjudged you, Outlanders. May a loon shine upon you.
The Outlanders helped him back as long as they could. Were you successful in planning the summit's defense?

Dialogue/NightElfExpCamp/NightElf01x/S01.transcription: Mistress, do you believe we can defeat Illidan even if we find him?
These tracks are fresh, but they split off in opposite directions. And they're done must be getting help from someone.
You watchers split up into two parties. Scour the woods. Find what you can. We'll meet you further up the coast.
Remember, sisters, if you find Illidan, do not attempt to take him without the rest of us. He is far too dangerous to tackle alone.
The rest of you, follow me.
We're getting close. I smell something vile upon the wind.
Illidan stench hangs heavily over this place. But those tracks were not made by any demons I know of. Be wary, my sisters. There's no telling what horrors Illidan has called to his side.
Illidan has grown powerful, of that there is no doubt. He consumed the energies of the skull of Gul'dan. Now he is neither Night Elf nor Demon, but something more.
The Legion's corruption still grips the land.
Their tribes suffered greatly during the Legion's invasion. They cannot be saved.
Report.
This madness must end. We will find the creature and put it down.
That's the creature we're after. Slade quickly and put it out of its misery.
As I suspected, their whole race has gone mad. Slay them all!
Ambush! The Saters are attacking! Drive the foul boots back!
So, Illidan sent you foul satyrs to slow us down. He must be getting desperate.
Illidan's new minions struck here as well. They're bloodthirsty and fearless, whoever they are.
We will find them.
You will release my warriors immediately.
Naga. Many craven races have tempted our rap over the centuries. None have survived.
These poor folk were slain just like the others. Illidan has much to answer for. He'll wish he were still chained in his cell when I get through with him.
I don't know. Wait. He may have taken to the sea. Hurry, sisters! The port of Nendes lies to the north. Perhaps there we can find a ship and set sail after Aladdin.
I cannot allow Illidan to escape again. We must slay those Naga before they burn the ships.
You're certainly welcome to Try Monster.
We must trust time to reveal all things. Now hurry. Illidan has a considerable lead on us. We must capture him before he causes any more harm.
Regid my levels. You are no match for the matter.
Retching woman, we will retake the surface world and put an end to your vile race once and for all.
Quickly your fools, the ships must be burned. The master doesn't wish to be followed.

"You are too late, little warden." The master has already set sail for distant shores. However, he wished to thank you for the hospitality you provided during his imprisonment. He asked us to repay you in time.
There, mistress, those must be the creatures we're after.
But these racks? Why would they destroy ships?
Mistress, why would the Naga harbor so much hatred for us?
"Wreck it, fools! You cannot stop a master. His is the hand of glory. His will shall be done."
Ugh, night elf watchers. I knew there were more of them skulking around out there.
I think not, woman. The master tires of your games. The chase ends here.
Your order's mistress.
Yes, Mistress.
Mr. Shadow Song, we're lucky to have found you.
My party was attacked by a bloodthirsty wildkin. Apparently, Illidan's passing drove the creature mad. There's no telling how many more in a sense it might harm.
Mr. Shadowsong, thank Elune. A band of saders captured the rest of my party. The twisted brutes are holding them in the nearby woods.
That village has been erased.
The bodies have been mutilated. Do you suppose demons did this?
Mistress, the furbogs have succumbed to the forest corruption. It is as if they have lost themselves to mindless rage.

Dialogue/NightElfExpCamp/NightElf02x/S02.transcription: Rest easy, stranger. This old wanderer has no quarrel with you or your kin. I am Druk Thule, once a powerful warlock of the Storm Reaver Clan. Now, I am the last of my kind.
"You're pardon, lady, but I am hunted by restless ghosts. They've chased me day and night for nearly twenty years. Perhaps if you silence them for me, I will tell you my tale."

Thank you, stranger. Now, hear my tale. Nearly twenty years ago, the Great Warlock, Gul'dan, raised these islands from the deeps. He sought to unearth an ancient vault that held the remains of the Dark Titan.

The same. After Sargeras's defeat ages ago, his remains were locked away in an undersea tomb. Gul'dan believed that opening the tomb would grant him the Dark Titan's power. For his pride, he and the rest of our clan were torn to shreds by crazed demons.
I have wondered these aisles ever since, haunted by the ghosts of my slaughtered comrades.
What we always do sell things. We have some of the finest boats and watercraft who ever sail upon the great sea. But uh, customers are kind of scarce around here if you know what I mean.
At last, the tomb of Sargeras is found.
You, my trusted servants, must remain here and guard the entrance. If that wretched warden managed to reach this island, she'll certainly try to follow us.
I suspected as much. These islands must have been formed only recently.
The ruins all around us, Nysha. I recognize them.
This was once the great city of Suramar. Built before our civilization was blasted beneath the sea ten thousand years ago.

Perhaps, though there are few powers left in the world capable of raising islands from the deeps. Regardless, it's a mystery we'll have to solve later. We'd best head inland and set up a base camp. Once we're situated, we'll pick up Illidan's trail.
Here, sisters, let's establish a base so we can continue our hunt for Illidan.
Perhaps. We should keep searching for more evidence.
Naga. Careful, sisters. There's no telling what the creatures have in store for us.
More naga! Slay them, sisters!
Naga, their presence here is a sacrilege to nature.
More of the bile serpents. Let none survive.
Ruins. Ghosts. That is all that is left of our proud ancient culture.
An ancient shrine of Elune. The goddess's light has forsaken this place.
I remember this place. It was once the great library of Isal Shura. There is no knowledge left here. Only nightmares and the shadows of regret.
These were the temple gardens of Araknashal. They once brimmed with wondrous flora and colors beyond reckoning. Now there are only weeds in the broken stones of memory.

Great trees once stood in this place. Twin Aspens called the Bals of Azshara. To look upon them was to know true peace, true fulfillment. Now they are gone, along with the hopes and dreams of a generation.
Whoever tore this island from the sea floor dredged up more than just broken stone. It is as if the ghosts of the ancients writhe upon the wind.
An orc. I smell the stench of demons about him.
What are you doing here?
I'll consider it.
There. Those must be the ghost the old orc spoke of. He seemed to be reliving their last battle. Their every bit as brutal and bloodthirsty as they were in life.
The dead will trouble you no more, old orc.
Sargeras, you speak of the Legion's creator.
Your tale is as intriguing as it is Diardrack Thule. It's a shame your ghosts lie silent. You deserve far worse than their company for what you set loose in this place.
An excavation site? Illidan must be trying to find the tomb of Sargeras for himself!
Whatever it is, we've got to stop Illidan before it's too late.
What are you creatures doing in this forsaken place?
These orcs look old, as if they've been living here for years. It seems they did survive the demon massacre, only to have their souls stripped from them.
Another dig site. Illidan must not know where the true tomb lies. We have to find it first.
We locked Illidan beneath the Earth long ago. I intend to do so again.
Now quickly my sisters, Illidan must be stopped at all costs.
Nidles! Kill them all in the Emperor's name!
Land walkers, destroy them quickly!
Ash de Rosanquina un bono d'ri!
Mistress, we followed Illidan's course due east, as you asked. But these strange islands do not appear on any of our maps.
What makes you say that?
But how could... Are you suggesting that these islands were somehow raised from the seafloor?
Look, mistress. More naga tracks. Biladin must have journeyed this way.
But what could he be seeking? If the old orc story was true, Gul'dan found only demons in the cursed tomb.
Those orcs are still corrupted by the Legion's power. I thought they had all been cured when Maneroth was defeated.
Whatever the case, they cannot be allowed to live.
Illidan, I knew we'd find him. We'll have to fight our way through the Naga's defenses in order to follow him.

Dialogue/NightElfExpCamp/NightElf03x/S03.transcription: Quickly you fools! Fan out and search for the primary passageway! We must reach the chamber of the eye before the tomb's guardians awaken!
Spineless cowards, I said move!
Now, Sargeras, I will claim whatever's left of your power and bring this wretched world to its knees.
Plastered, feeble-minded weaklings, they're all likely dead by now.
Still, I must press on. My power alone should be enough to
That laughter is that you, Sargeras. You seek to mock me. We'll see who lasts last demon when I claim your burning eye for my own.
Am bushed by the guardians. I am dying.
If my servants had not abandoned me, I could have claimed the 'I' and
Damn you, Sagaris! I won't be beaten like this! I am Gul'dan! I am darkness incarnate! It cannot end like this!
*laughs* So. Warden's Shadow Song. You've made it at last. I knew you would.
