"Nivatade does not suit you. When I consume the power of Gul'dan's skull, I inherited his memories, especially those of this place, and the dark prize he coveted."
That power is beyond my reach, little warden. But this...
The Eye of Sargeras contains all the power I'll need to rid this wretched world of my enemies once and for all. Ironic that you should be its first victim.
Isolation can do that to the mind. Now, after all the long centuries you kept me chained in darkness. It is only fitting that I bury you in turn.
You've come far enough, little warden. Your vaunted night elf justice has no jurisdiction here.
Why my dear, we naga were once night elves.
We were Azshara's chosen, the Highborn, banished beneath the cruel seas, when the well of eternity imploded around us.
Cursed, transformed. We have waited 10,000 years to retake our rightful place in the world. And now, with Lord Illidan's help, we shall.
Your courage is commendable, but it shall avail you nothing.
Still, we must press on Nysha. If Illidan finds whatever it is he's seeking, he could... Wait, look there.
Strange. These are orcish runes. They were written by Gul'dan when he first opened this tomb 20 years ago.
Apparently he logged his journey through the tomb's depths. These runes seem to depict that history.
There's no telling what Gul'dan and his lackeys awoke in this foul place. We must be cautious.
Gul'dan led them blindly to their deaths. Still, they hunger for revenge.
I can hear our comrades' voices from the other side of this barrier. If we destroy it, they'll be able to get inside and help us hunt for Illidan.
Destroy that barrier so our forces outside can join us.
There, more of Gul'dan's glyphs. Interesting. They continue the warlock's tale.
An artifact, no doubt. It must have contained tremendous demonic power to lure Gul'dan as it did.
Strange. It's a statue of Azshara, the great queen of old. She led our people to ruin by consorting with Sargeras and his burning legion. Only, I don't recall her ever having a tale.
I don't know Nisha, but her image chills me to the core.
What would you know of us or our justice, Naga Witch?
Impossible.
Not while I draw breath.
Yes, Gul'dan's script seems to grow more desperate. It reads that he was...
This is as far as he got. The runes simply trail off. I cannot imagine what horrors Gudan faced in his final moments.
You have much to pay for, Illidan. I'm taking you back to your cell.
Yes, the power of Sargeras. You would claim it as your own.
You're insane.
Damn, I must reach Shonto Stormrage and warn him of his brother's treachery. My power will allow me to escape, but I fear there is no way out for the rest of you.
I will not forget you, my sisters. You will be avenged. I swear it.
Now I've got to find a way out, before this cursed tomb is drowned by the seas.
This is a piece of Gul'dan's shadow orb. He must have shattered it by accident. If we can find the other missing pieces, we could reassemble the orb and use its power to aid us.
Finally, the last piece of the Shadow Orb. Now we'll use Gul'dan's own artifact to discover what he could not.
I hear Dark Whispering beyond this gate. It could be Illidan and his minions.
I have a bad feeling about this, mistress. It's too quiet. It feels as if we're walking into a trap.
What do they say?
More on Dead Orcs.
Again, he referenced this mysterious eye. What could it be?
She looks more like a naga than one of us. Would those foul serpents have any reason to worship our queen?
Look, mistress. More of Gul'dan's glyphs.
Go, Mistress. The goddess will light our path to the hereafter.
Turn back, you mortals! None may defile the tomb of Sagaras!

Dialogue/NightElfExpCamp/NightElf04x/S04.transcription: It's too late, Mistress. Illidan's forces have arrived.
Mistress, we've discovered a dig site. Perhaps it holds an artifact from our ancient kingdom.
The runner is in trouble. Protect her!
Praise Elune, the runner made it. She's reached the shore.

They are lost. Illidan claimed the Eye of Sargeras and used its power to bury our sisters alive. Now he intends to finish the rest of us off. We have no choice but to sail back to Kalimdor and warn Shondo Stormrage of what his brother intends.
We cannot escape. But perhaps we can send for reinforcements. Some in the runner, she must reach the shoreline and sail back to Kalimdor.
With any luck, Shondo Stormrage will reach us before we're overrun. Be swift, sister.
Scour the Digsite. We'll take whatever it holds for our own. Goddess Willing, we'll find something to aid us against Illidan and his serpents.
Damn. The runner has been slain. There's no way to call for reinforcements now.
Iluan Grant that she reaches Shondo Stormrage in time. If not, Illidan may never be stopped.
What happened, Mistress? Where are Nisha and the others?

Dialogue/NightElfExpCamp/NightElf04xInte.transcription: Your pardon, Chandor Stormridge, Priestess Tyrande, but she insisted that she be allowed to see you.
Nodrassal's route seemed to be healing well. I wish I could say the same for Felwood. I fear the Legion's corruption will scar the Glade permanently.
No, my love. The druids and I can handle.
Then we shall both go. If this girl's tale is true, Myev will need all the help she can get.
I am a servant of the Warden, Maiev Shadowsong. She who pledged to hunt down the betrayer Illidan.

You're part in Shondo, but your brother has raised a dark army from the sea and stolen a powerful demonic artifact. Even now my mistress battles him on the Broken Isles. She requires immediate reinforcements.
Your druids will think of something. Perhaps Ysera or Alexstrasse could lend there.
Who are you girl? What is so urgent?
I will go. I will lead the sentinels there myself.
I am the one who's setting free. The responsibility is mine.

Dialogue/NightElfExpCamp/NightElf05x/S05.transcription: We've landed safely, but a few of our ships may have run aground on the outlying islands. I hate to leave any of our forces behind, but we simply have no time to wait.
Perhaps force of nature will speed our way.
I don't know, but these creatures feel familiar somehow.
We'll have to fight our way through the naga to reach Mayev.
Just as I suspected, our ships did run aground here. The special allies I brought from Ashenvale should be somewhere in the vicinity.
Just keep searching. You'll know them when you see them.
There, our missing comrades, the mountain giants.
The legions coming awoke many of our old friends from their timeless slumber. These mighty ones will be of great help to us.
The jungle here is impassable. I'll need to use force of nature to clear a path for us.
We must move quickly to save my Ev.
We must reach the warden's base quickly.
I'm glad we reached you in time, Mayav.
Stop this, both of you. We're not out of danger yet. My Ev, what's the situation here?
Very well. Let's get moving then.
I've come to stop you, Illidan. Instead of banishing you, I should have returned you to your cage when I had the chance. I was weak then, but no longer.
This battle is far from over, Myev. Illidan has yet to be accounted for. And I've seen no sign of Tyrande either.
Don't worry, my love. We'll find Illidan wherever he runs. We'll find him.
Tyrande, what are you doing here? This battle does not concern you.
Monster, is that what you think of me? I have always cared for you, Tyrande. I sought only to prove my worthiness, my power.
Still, you refuse to see me for what I truly am. You believe me to be a villain, your enemy. But soon now, you will see that our enemies are the same.
I can scarcely believe you survived. You are more resourceful than I imagined, Little Warden.
Brother, what are you doing here?
I have sworn allegiance to a new master brother. I have a great task to perform in his service. I'm sorry, but I cannot allow you to stand in my way.
Not yet, my little priestess. A pity you couldn't see things my way. Now you and the whole world will understand just what I'm capable of. Ask her off!
Hold your ground, my warriors! Goddess Willing, Shondo Stormrage will come!
I'll loom be praised. I knew you would come Shondo Stormrage.
Priestess Tyrande, I'm surprised you came in person. Are you here to absolve your guilty conscience?
What you did was murder my watchers and set the betrayer free. It is you who should be locked in a cage.
There are no resources left in this area, Shondo. We'll need to find a goldmine if we're to marshal more troops for an assault on Illidan's compound.
We've wasted too much time. The longer we wait to attack, the stronger Illidan's forces become. We must strike soon, Shondo.
I am the hand of Justice Illidan. Long ago, I swore an oath to keep you chained, and by all the gods I shall.
Victory is ours. It has been an honor to fight at your side, Shondo.
Richard Night Elves. We are the Naga. We are the Future.
My owls have already scouted ahead of us and found Myev's location. She and her forces are under attack, but we'll need to pass through the jungle to reach her.
We'd best make haste. I doubt Mayav's forces can hold out much longer.
What are these vile serpents?
Then these foul beasts shall feel the wrath of the goddess's light.
Special allies.
By aloof. I haven't seen one of their kind in ages.
We're running out of time. We must reach Mayev quickly.
Mayev's forces won't hold out much longer.
I did what I had to do, Maya. You are in no position to judge me.
I was wrong to set you free, Illidan. I can see that now. You've become a monster.
Raw power is no substitute for true strength, Illidan. That is why I chose your brother over you.
Show yourself, Illidan! It's over!

Dialogue/NightElfExpCamp/NightElf06x/S06.transcription: Strangers, my lord. They don't appear to be undead, but...

This land is called Lordaeron, Mayev. It is the homeland of the Alliance that aided us at the Battle of Mount Haizhel. I was told that its kingdoms, both human and elven, were consumed by the undead scourge.
These forests have suffered grievously. I must leave you both for a time. I will enter the woods and attempt to commune with the land itself.
I expect you both to stay focused on your task. You can settle your personal dispute after we've found my brother.
Ishanwala, Night Elves. I am Prince Kael'thas. I must admit, I'm surprised to see your kind here. But whatever your business, I fear you will find only death and shadow in this cursed land.

Curious. I don't know about any demon, but some things riled the undead based at Dalaran. They've been hounding us day and night. We were about to abandon this post and seek refuge on the other side of the river Aravas.
It would be an honor, my lady.
The undead are attacking! The caravan must be protected!
We'll stop here for provisions.
Sadly, I have only a few warriors left. The Scourge has pressed us hard these last few months.

The scourge devoured our ancient homeland of Quelthavas. The once proud bloodline of my people is nearly spent. The few of us that remain now call ourselves blood elves in homage to our murdered people.
The caravan is under attack!
Protect the caravan at all costs.
The undead have returned! Defend the caravan!
The caravan is newly destroyed. We must hold them back!
We've nearly lost a caravan. It must be defended!
This is one of our last holdouts on this side of the river. We will rest here for a spell and gather reinforcements.
Ah, a mercenary camp. We could hire some of them to aid us. But we'll need to retrieve some of our hidden gold caches in order to pay them.
We're fighting a losing war here, Milady. The undead close in around us daily. It's necessary to keep our assets hidden yet accessible. We have caches secreted throughout the wilderness.
We stand at a crossroads, my friends.
There is a shorter path to our destination, but it will take us perilously close to an undead bastion.
The other route is safer, but it will take us longer to cross the river.
This is the bastion I told you about. It must be destroyed if the caravan is to make it through.
Ah, Pyrewood Village, the river out of us lies just beyond.
Damn! They were waiting for us! Protect the caravan at all costs!
We've run out of time. The caravan will not survive another assault.
It's working. She's holding them back.
We must hurry to save her! That current will take her straight into the heart of the undead lands.
Our forces will be ready to move out soon. Although we still know next to nothing about this strange land Aladdin has run to.
While you're gone, we'll set out and try to pick up Illidan's trail.
Of course, Shondo. We'd best get moving.
Isnu Daldi Abkhail Thos. I am my Ev Shadow Song, and this is Tyrande Whisperwind. We are hunting a powerful demon that arrived here recently.
Wait, we have no time for this?
We are wasting time here, Tyrande. We should be out looking for Illidan.
Do not fear kale. Our mountain giants are more than capable of handling these wretched curves. Their stony hides are newly impervious to their clumsy attacks.
Kao, where are your high elven brethren? Do they not fight the undead as you do?
You've hidden your gold?
then we shall retrieve them for you.
This is where Cale buried his gold. Let's claim it quickly.
Ah, more of the alliance's treasury. Let's take it and be gone.
More of the bearing gold. This will help our cause greatly.
Both routes will be dangerous nonetheless. Let us choose quickly and be on our way.
Undead Flyers, we must find a way to repel them.
Something doesn't feel right.
We've driven them back, but the second wave is advancing.
That's very noble of you, Priestess. But you're no match for a force that vast.
No, Kale. Taranda is a soldier. She knew the risks she took. We have a greater mission to accomplish now, and our time grows short.
Your people are now safe. You will uphold your end of the bargain and help me hunt the demon I seek.
This was an alliance encampment. The attack must have come recently.
Hmm, then we shall lend you our aid, young kale.
Perhaps once your people are safe, you will help us hunt the demon we seek.
These people need our help, Mayav. Their brethren aided us against the Legion. We will honor that debt now.
I agree for your people, Kale. But you must not allow rage and despair to poison your heart. You may yet lead your people to a brighter future.
Yes. Perhaps we should keep the caravan moving.
Their numbers are limitless.
They just keep coming.
Cale, get your caravan moving across the river. I will stay behind and hold the bridge.
The goddess is my shield, Warden. Elune will grant me the strength.
Merciful goddess.

Dialogue/NightElfExpCamp/NightElf06xInte.transcription: This forest has suffered as much as Ashenvale. The vile blight of the scourge has deadened countless acres of trees. If only the druids could.
Ahhh! The Earth is being torn apart! The pain is excruciating.
Ancient spirits of the forest. I implore you. Show me what is hidden from my sight. Show me what troubles this earth.
I see the frozen land of Northrend, the very roof of the world. The land itself is being split asunder.
How can this be? What could cause such devastation?
Thank you, great spirits. I know what must be done. I promise you. This treachery will not go unpunished.
It's working. Nothing can withstand the power of the eye. Soon now, my master's enemies will be undone, and I will claim my just reward.

Dialogue/NightElfExpCamp/NightElf07x/S07.transcription: Maiev, we've got to move quickly. Illidan is weaving a spell that is splitting apart the roof of the world. We must... Wait. Where is Tyrande?
Torn apart. Tyrande, my heart. I should have been there.
It doesn't matter. They won't live long enough to finish their spell. Illidan must be stopped once and for all.
I feel their spell ripping through the roof of the world. We must end this!
Ugh, the eye is fracturing the earth. The pain is excruciating.
The land is heaving. Even here, we must put an end to their spell.
It is over, brother. Your vile schemes end here.
My victory draws near.
Soon my enemies will burn.
Turn back and tend to your own affairs. You cannot stop the inevitable.
I will not be denied. The spell must be completed.
No! The spell is not done! It is not done!
Greetings, great druid. My scouts have confirmed that this Illidan and his vile snakes are based at the ruined city of Dalaran. They are using a gem-like artifact to perform some strange ritual.
We'll hold the nugga back for as long as we can, for quell the loss.
Be wary. The vile naga are regrouping.
Push on. The Naga lines are weakening.
The Naga have captured some human paladins. If we could free them, they might aid us against Illidan.
I'm sorry, Shondo, but the priestess has fallen. We aided a band of alliance warriors against the undead. The priestess fought valiantly, but I saw her torn apart with my own eyes.
You can still avenge her, Shondo. Let us attack Illidan together. He is the reason we even came to this forsaken place. He is the reason for your loss.
Shondo, this is Prince Kaelthas, the ally I spoke of.
They must be using the Eye of Sargeras. But why would they strike at the roof of the world?
We've broken through their lines. Fight on my friends. Illidan cannot evade us forever.
Their defenses are broken. Illidan shall be mine.
Illidan Stormrage for recklessly endangering countless lives and threatening the very balance of the world. I hereby sentence you to death.
Our righteous might will always overcome the forces of darkness. We shall aid you against these unholy beasts.

Dialogue/NightElfExpCamp/NightElf07xInte.transcription: Too much blood has been spilled on your account, Illidan. Even now, I can feel the lands of Northrend reeling from the spell you cast. Imprisonment will not be enough this time.
And no heed to the cost, because of you, Tyrande is dead.
You told me she was torn apart. You lied to me.
Just who is the betrayer now, woman? I must go to her immediately.
Silence! I will deal with you later. Let's go, brother.
Force! Can you not see? The spell we channeled was meant to strike at the undead! Our common enemy! My mission was to destroy the Lich King's stronghold of Icecrown!
Believe me, brother. Despite all our differences, you know that I would never lead Tyrande to harm. Let me help you. My naga can scour the river for us. Let me do this, at least.
You're pardon Lord Stormrage, but the priestess may still be alive. She was swept downriver, but it's premature to simply assume that
The betrayer's capture was our primary concern, Shondo. I needed your help. I knew you would go to her, and we would lose our chance. I...
What? After all he's done, he would trust this traitor too.

Dialogue/NightElfExpCamp/NightElf08x/S08.transcription: They had best return with good news, brother. The very sight of them makes my stomach turn. Where did you ever find such loathsome creatures?
Teramba
We cannot depend on them now. Illidan, you must hold the undead here and prevent them from assaulting Tyrande's encampment. I will journey downriver and...
What you say is true, but a risk much by trusting you, Illidan.
I believe you. Under Thoris Sathil, brother.
Where could they be? He should have brought her back by now.
Tyrande
I thought I'd lost you forever, my love. If not for Illidan's aid, I may well have.
Prince Kael'thas said he last sought Aranda being swept down this river. If she is alive, my naga will find her.
Believe me, brother, you do not want to know.
An undead strike force! But they're completely ignoring us.
They're flying horrors filled the sky. It would be folly to send your fliers against them.
No, brother. The Naga and I can reach her faster. I will go.
I swear on my life that I will bring her back, my brother.
We shall see.
No, Tyrande. You must believe me. I've come to save you.
Hurry! This is our last chance!
Whatever I may be, whatever I may become in this world, know that I will always look out for you, Taranda.
We have had much strife between us, my brother. I have known only ages of hate for you. But for my part, I wish it to end. From this day forward, let there be peace between us.
Lord Illidan, we have found your missing priestess. She and our warriors fight on against the undead, but I doubt they can hold out much longer.
You'd best hurry if you're to save her.
Lord Illidan, we've discovered a dam blocking one of the river's tributaries. The dam is guarded by forest trolls, but this stream beyond it might provide us a faster route to your friend.
Come forth, you mindless wretches, and taste the wrath of the sentinels. A loon's light shall never falter.
"Vite on, my warriors. We must hold on to hope."
Another wave. We must hold out.
They come again. They will not find us easy prey. Attack!
Their numbers are limitless. We must hold on.
We've got to keep fighting. It cannot end this way.
Goddess, if this is to be the end, let us die with your name on our lips.
Keep fighting, my warriors. They may be our end, but they will never defeat our spirit.
Illidan, what trickery is this? Have you come to finish me off personally?
Save me.
You risked your life for me. I don't understand.
I knew he would not forsake me.

Dialogue/NightElfExpCamp/NightElf08xInte.transcription: You have brought much suffering to the world, Illidan. For that, you can never be forgiven. However, you saved the life of my love. For that I will let you go. But should you ever threaten my people again?
It's no use, Turanda. She has become vengeance itself, bound forever to the hunt. I only pray that in her zeal she doesn't cause even more havoc than Illidan.

I understand, brother. Lordship over this world was never my aim. Only power. Only the magic. I've lingered here too long. I must go. By aiding you, I've betrayed my new master. If I am not careful, his wrath will be my end.
Farewell, brother. Tyrande. I doubt our path through Cross again. Enshoe Falena.
Fools! Have you no sense of justice?
Mayev, Illidan has atoned for his crimes. He is no longer a threat to...
Now, let's go home, beloved. We've earned our rest.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc01/O01Cairne23.m.transcription: I am Cairn, chief of the Bloodhoaf Torren. You green skins fight with both savagery and valor. I am intrigued.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc01/O01Cairne25.m.transcription: "Seeking destiny?" "It will find you in time, young one." "However, there is an oracle far to the north which might be able to..."

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc01/O01Cairne27.m.transcription: What? No. My village is in danger.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc01/O01Cairne29.m.transcription: Ugh! We could do some help, friends!

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc01/O01Cairne30.m.transcription: We've arrived in time. The next wave is advancing.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc01/O01Cairne32.m.transcription: Ah, they've brought a champion with them this time.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc01/O01Cairne35.m.transcription: Thanks to you, young warchief. But the centaur drove off all the game in this region, and I cannot allow my people to starve. Soon, we must head north to the verrant grasslands of Moldor.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc01/O01Cairne37.m.transcription: Yes. The devil's speed cannot be matched upon the planes.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc01/O01Cairne39.m.transcription: I am intrigued by you and your people, Young Thrall. You are more than welcome to join us.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc01/O01Grunt01.mp.transcription: Or Chief, our ship sustained heavy damage when we passed through the raging maelstrom. It's unsalvageable.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc01/O01Grunt03.mp.transcription: We traveled to West as you instructed. This should be it.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc01/O01Grunt05.mp.transcription: No war chief, not since we got separated.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc01/O01Grunt08.mp.transcription: At least they're prettier than the humans.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc01/O01Grunt10.mp.transcription: A great battle to place here. The clay is red with fresh blood.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc01/O01Grunt14.mp.transcription: From Car War Chief, we knew you'd find us.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc01/O01Grunt16.mp.transcription: No, War Chief. We were separated in the storm. We only just arrived.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc01/O01Grunt17.mp.transcription: Or Chief, there's another of our ships!

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc01/O01Grunt43.mp.transcription: We should check these crates for valuable supplies.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc01/O01Grunt44.mp.transcription: This is one of our ship's warchief. It must have been smashed against the rocks in the storm.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc01/O01Grunt47.mp.transcription: Chieftain, this wreck has been abandoned for quite some time. Perhaps the crew has survived and is around here someplace.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc01/O01Grunt48.mp.transcription: Pinch the town! Burn it to the ground!

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc01/O01HeadHunter.transcription: Thanks for saving us, man. We should hurry. The Pikmin said there were other ships nearby.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc01/O01Thrall02.m.transcription: Hmm, I knew it. Can we confirm our location? Is this Kalimdor?

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc01/O01Thrall04.m.transcription: Very well. Has there been any sign of Graham Hillscreen or the other ships?

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc01/O01Thrall06.m.transcription: Hmm. Prepare to move out. If our comrades did make it here, we should be able to find them along the coast.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc01/O01Thrall07.m.transcription: Hmm, those pig creatures are unlike anything I've ever seen before.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc01/O01Thrall09.m.transcription: Those hideous creatures have the bodies of horses. LOKTEROGAR!

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc01/O01Thrall11.m.transcription: Is there nothing in this land but dust and carnage?

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc01/O01Thrall12.m.transcription: The horsemen are slaughtering those bull creatures. I let us here to escape senseless conflict. Now it seems, we're surrounded by it.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc01/O01Thrall13.m.transcription: Hmm, the horsemen look as if they're dressed for war.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc01/O01Thrall15.m.transcription: Thrumka, warrior. I'm glad you're all safe. Were you part of Hillscreens Group?

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc01/O01Thrall18.m.transcription: Ah, these cliffs are too steep. We'll need to head inland and swing back around to reach it.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc01/O01Thrall20.m.transcription: Well met, Warrior. Has there been any sign of...

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc01/O01Thrall24.m.transcription: I am Thrall, and these are my brethren, the Orcs. We've come seeking the destiny promised to us.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc01/O01Thrall26.m.transcription: North, but there's an army of the horsemen marching north.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc01/O01Thrall28.m.transcription: I must know more about this Oracle. Follow them! Protect Cairn at all costs!

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc01/O01Thrall31.m.transcription: Look, no, us! Here they come again!

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc01/O01Thrall34.m.transcription: Your tribe is safe, old one.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc01/O01Thrall36.m.transcription: and you fear the marauders will overtake you.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc01/O01Thrall38.m.transcription: Well, if you tell us how to reach the oracle you spoke of, then my brethren and I will escort you on your march.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc01/O01Troll21.mp.transcription: The horsemen are charging! Defend yourselves!

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc02/O02Cairne02.m.transcription: Yes, we Torren have always held a great respect for the works of the Earth Mother. There are far worse fates than living freely upon the open plains, young Warchief.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc02/O02Cairne05.m.transcription: They shall not catch the torrent unprepared.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc02/O02Cairne08.m.transcription: Ha! There's no need to coddle me, boy. I may be old, but I'm not helpless.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc02/O02Cairne11.m.transcription: Hold your formations, the codos must be protected.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc02/O02Cairne15.m.transcription: The centaur have returned! We're under attack!

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc02/O02Cairne17.m.transcription: The marauders attack again. Stand and fight my brethren!

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc02/O02Cairne23.m.transcription: This past leads straight to Mulgore, but I fear the caravan will be overrun before it reaches the other side.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc02/O02Cairne25.m.transcription: Let the fury of the Earth Mother deal with these retchers as they deserve.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc02/O02Cairne26.m.transcription: They will trouble us no more! And you, young Warchief, are free to continue your quest.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc02/O02Cairne28.m.transcription: Legends say that it saw the strands of fate as they were woven by the Earth Mother. It alone can show you your destiny.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc02/O02Cairne30.m.transcription: Far to the north, near the shadowy base of Mount Hyjal, lies Stone Talon Peak. You will find the oracle within the peak's hollow. I will send my finest codos to aid you in your journey.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc02/O02Cairne32.m.transcription: Go with honor, young warchief. May the Earthmother smile upon you.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc02/O02Grunt04.mp.transcription: War Chief, we've spotted a herd of marauders bearing down on us.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc02/O02Harpy18.mp.transcription: Come, sisters! It's been too long since we feasted on Outlander Flesh.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc02/O02Thrall01.m.transcription: This land is rugged and beautiful, much like the place from which my people originally come.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc02/O02Thrall03.m.transcription: Hmm, perhaps. But my people deserve a land to call their own kin.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc02/O02Thrall06.m.transcription: Assume defensive positions! Look tarogaar! Let none stand in our way!

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc02/O02Thrall07.m.transcription: Cairn, the codos are overburdened and must rest. Why don't you remain here and protect the caravan while we search for a suitable oasis?

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc02/O02Thrall12.m.transcription: Thram ka, warrior. You're from the war song, are you not?

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc02/O02Thrall14.m.transcription: Don't worry. We'll find them. For now, drink from the pool. The spirits of this place will replenish your strength.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc02/O02Thrall19.m.transcription: I wouldn't advise it, ladies. Once my wolfriders bring you to the ground, you'll have little chance against us.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc02/O02Thrall20a..transcription: What song catapults? Those could be useful.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc02/O02Thrall22.m.transcription: This place has been defiled. I sense that the spirits have fled.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc02/O02Thrall24.m.transcription: Cairn! The caravan will never make it in time!

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc02/O02Thrall27.m.transcription: to the Oracle. What is it?

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc02/O02Thrall31.m.transcription: Thank you, Cairn. I will not forget you.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc02/O02WarsongOrc.transcription: Yes, War Chief. Hellscream sent our party to find you. But we were separated when the horsemen attacked.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc02/O02WolfRider1.transcription: Hail Orcheve, how may we serve you?

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc02Interlude/O02A.transcription: And you are mine, Maneroth. You would do well to remember that fact. We will watch the wayward orcs and wait. Despite their failure, they may still prove useful to us.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc02Interlude/O02M.transcription: BAH! These frail humans offer no rear resistance.
Do not mock me, Dracula. I am aware of the orcs failure when I find them. I will discipline them myself.
"Calumdoor, but what could they be? Bah, the orcs are mine by right, and I will claim them wherever they choose to run."

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc02Interlude/O02T.transcription: Hail Mighty Maneroth! How goes the invasion?
Then the scourge did its job well, unlike some others I could name.
Yes, actually, that's why I've come. I thought you might like to know that the orcs are no longer here.
Certain as ever, manneroth, my agents at least, are always dependable. They told me that the orcs have landed on Kalimdor.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc03/O03Archmage06.transcription: "Wretched Orcs! How dare you follow us to this land!"

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc03/O03Grom07.mp3.transcription: Save your breath, human! You'll need it to scream when I start tearing off your limbs.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc03/O03Grom09.mp3.transcription: Same way we did, little brother. Apparently, a frail girl named Proudmoer leads them. Her forces have cordoned off the past that leads to the North.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc03/O03Grom14.mp3.transcription: I can wait no longer. But humans must be slaughtered!

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc03/O03Grom22.mp3.transcription: Hmm, a true warrior would simply take the past from the humans.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc03/O03Grom24.mp3.transcription: Don't lecture me, pup. The wretch is deserved death. Don't you feel it, Thrall? It's like the old days, like the demons are near.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc03/O03Grom26.mp3.transcription: Hmm. I'm sorry, Thrall. You're right. I... I can handle it.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc03/O03Grunt01.mp.transcription: War Chief, we've been trudging through this wasteland for a week with nothing to fight but centaurs and pigmen. We need real enemies to test our metal.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc03/O03Grunt04.mp.transcription: Look, it's the War Song Clan, and they're battling humans!

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc03/O03Grunt15.mp.transcription: Warchief! The war-song clan is attacking the humans despite your orders!

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc03/O03Grunt19.mp.transcription: War Chief! The War's song clan is attacking another human encampment!

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc03/O03Hunter12.m.transcription: Hey, boss man. We spotted multiple human encampments nearby. There also be a goblin laboratory protected by a base to the north.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc03/O03Thrall02.m.transcription: Yes, boredom and the beating sun have put us all on edge. But we must push on. All will be made clear once we meet the Oracle.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc03/O03Thrall05.m.transcription: What? Loktar warriors! Hellscream needs help!

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc03/O03Thrall08.m.transcription: Grum, what was this about? And how the hell did these humans get here anyway?

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc03/O03Thrall10.m.transcription: Hmm, well, we must make it through the past despite her. I'll send our hunters to scout the area while we establish a base. Until then, the humans are not to be touched.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc03/O03Thrall13.m.transcription: Interesting. If we can reach the goblins without incident, we can hire their zeppelins to fly us above the pass.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc03/O03Thrall18.m.transcription: Damn it. There's nothing to do now but fight. Tighten our defenses. I'll deal with hell scream later.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc03/O03Thrall20.m.transcription: Perhaps this is our destiny. To go on fighting the humans forever.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc03/O03Thrall21.m.transcription: With these, we can reach Stone Talon Peak by morning.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc03/O03Thrall23.m.transcription: Have you lost what's left of your mind, Grom? I gave you a direct order to leave the humans alone. What the hell is wrong with you?

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc03/O03Thrall25.m.transcription: I don't know what's come over you and your men, but this bloodlust is a liability that I can't afford.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc03/O03Thrall27.m.transcription: I can't take that chance, Grum. Take your clan into the Northern Forest and build us a settlement. I'll come and find you after we've reached the Oracle.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc04/O04Goblin17.m.transcription: Ah! Greetings, good orc! Strange to see one of you in these parts.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc04/O04Goblin19.m.transcription: Hmm. Well, there's this tribe of bearmen called Ferbogs in this region that's been giving us trouble. If you kill the chieftain, we'll sell our goods to you at cost. We might even let you borrow a few shredders.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc04/O04Goblin22.m.transcription: Ah, thank you. Now, these shredders will cut through those trees in no time.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc04/O04Grom01.mp3.transcription: Damn Thrall for sending us away. He chooses to use his greatest warriors for manual labor. He'll be lost without me.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc04/O04Grom03.mp3.transcription: Are you all afraid of spirits now? There is nothing here but ancient trees and shadow.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc04/O04Grom07.mp3.transcription: "Still your tongue and get to work. The War Chief's new settlement will require a great deal of lumber. This section of forest must be cleared."

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc04/O04Grom08.mp3.transcription: Those dancing lights are strange. Perhaps they are the dread spirits that you've all been so afraid of.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc04/O04Grom12.mp3.transcription: Yes, they almost look like elves. But they're far too tall and far too savage.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc04/O04Grom14.mp3.transcription: Hmm, they won't last long, after our wolf riders haven't snared them.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc04/O04Grom16.mp3.transcription: Hmm. These women fight with unmatched savagery. I've never seen their equal. They are perfect warriors.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc04/O04Grom18.mp3.transcription: We are here to cut lumber, Little Goblin.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc04/O04Grom21.mp3.transcription: They must be the furbogs the goblin spoke of. This will be a worthy battle.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc04/O04Grom25.mp3.transcription: "Baa! Am I surrounded only by cowards? It's a tree like any other! Cut it down!"

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc04/O04Grom26.mp3.transcription: You see, the great tree provided us with an abundance of lumber. If we find any more, then we'll hack them apart as well.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc04/O04Grom27.mp3.transcription: We've nearly hit our quota. Our lumber stores are almost full.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc04/O04Grom29.mp3.transcription: Good, then we'll start constructing the settlement immediately.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc04/O04Huntress09.transcription: You were right, sisters. These green-skinned brutes have no respect for life. Slay them in Elune's name.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc04/O04WarsongOrc.transcription: "Chiefton, there's something strange about these woods. It's too quiet, almost like we're being watched."
You hear that? This place is haunted. I fear no living enemy, but my acts cannot cleave fleshless spirits.
Jieftain, the warrior women have returned on flying beasts!
"Chiefton, that great tree pulses with magic. We should keep our distance."
Chief Den, the harvesting is complete.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc04Interlude/O04M.transcription: Ashenvale Forest. After 10,000 years, I still recognize this cursed place. This is the veil of our ancient enemy, the night elves demigod scenarios.
Hmm, I would relish the chance to face him again in combat. But he is crafty and rarely appears in the open.
Hmm, they would have little chance against scenarios. If memory serves, his powers were quite formidable.
Hmm... Just what are you suggesting, dreadlord?

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc04Interlude/O04T.transcription: Yes, Lord Archimonde demands that scenarios be destroyed before we launch the invasion of Kalimdor.
"Faitful as it sounds, your pet orcs have recently despoiled these forest lands and incurred his wrath. Lord Archimonde and I believe that the orcs are capable of killing scenarios for us."
Yes, but so are yours. The blood pack that you made with the orcs longer goes still binds them to you. You need only recharge their energies.
Spill your burning blood into this pool. Its corruption will lure the orcs to it. And once they've tasted your blood again, they will be unstoppable.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc05/O05Cenarius01.transcription: Who dares defile this ancient land? Who dares the wrath of sonarius and the night elves?

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc05/O05Cenarius07.transcription: Now, my warriors, cleanse these brutes from the wilds. I will watch over you from the forest.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc05/O05Cenarius27.transcription: Demon spawned wretches, you will all die!

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc05/O05Cenarius28.transcription: I defeated your kind in ages past, and I shall do so again.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc05/O05Cenarius29.transcription: You cannot defeat me. I am the heart of the land.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc05/O05Cenarius34.transcription: The demons did their job well. You creatures are as reckless and bloodthirsty as they ever were.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc05/O05Cenarius36.transcription: Is that what you tell yourself? Despite what you may believe, you are no better than a malignant bile that flows through your veins.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc05/O05Grom18.mp3.transcription: Weak-minded coward, nothing is invincible. If we are to live, then this scenario must die.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc05/O05Grom21.mp3.transcription: I don't know what you are or who you serve, but no one bars my way.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc05/O05Grom23.mp3.transcription: "I am cursed already! If I must drink from these waters to defeat scenarios, then I will."

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc05/O05Grom25.mp3.transcription: No warrior. We must embrace it as never before. We must become the vessels of destruction that we were meant to be.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc05/O05Grom26.mp3.transcription: "Yes!" "I feel the power once again!" "Come, my warriors! Drink from the dark waters, and you will be reborn!"

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc05/O05Grom38.mp3.transcription: The demigod has fallen. The war song is supreme.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc05/O05Grunt44.mp.transcription: Their numbers are too great. We must fall back to the other side of the river!

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc05/O05Mannoroth4.transcription: I've come to bring you and your brethren back into the fold. Though you orcs failed the Burning Legion before, you will now serve us once again.
*sigh* Stupid, beautiful creature. I am the rage in your heart. I am the fury of your thoughts. I alone, empowered you to bring chaos to this world, and by the endless voids you shall.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc05/O05Satyr20.mp.transcription: Fowl orcs! The Burning Masters charged us with protecting this well. You are unworthy of drinking from these dark waters.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc05/O05WarsongOrc.transcription: The forest is coming alive! We're under attack!
"Chieftain, these creatures press us hard, and the demigod still lurks in the forest. How can we possibly defeat him?"
No! That goes against everything the War Chief teaches us! We can't let rage overcome us again!

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc05/O05WitchDocto.transcription: "Hair scream! I sense a dock power emanating from the wilderness! It might be a key to destroying scenarios."
The dark energies that I sense come from the pool!
The pool emanates grave power, but I smell this stench of a demon curse above it.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc06/O06Cairne03.m.transcription: Isn't it a little poorer, young warchief?

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc06/O06Cairne05.m.transcription: Our debt to you orcs can only be repaid with blood. We've come to help you reach the oracle. However, those metalclad pink skins look like trouble.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc06/O06Cairne07.m.transcription: Hmm. The Oracle's wisdom belongs to all. Perhaps the Wyverns that live nearby can be of use to us. They have no love for hostile intruders.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc06/O06Cairne08.m.transcription: The harpies have enslaved the wyverns.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc06/O06Cairne10.m.transcription: There. These proud beasts will now aid us in reaching the summit.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc06/O06Cairne23.m.transcription: Be wary, young one. That cave is the perfect spot for an ambush.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc06/O06Harpy09.mp.transcription: Be warned, old fool. Stone-talent peak is ours. Neither these brutes nor the humans will leave this place alive. Attack my sisters!

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc06/O06OrcScout01.transcription: "War Chief, we scouted the peak as you ordered. The humans have entrenched their fortifications all the way up to the summit."

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc06/O06Thrall02.m.transcription: What are they up to? They're looking to pick a fight they've had ample opportunities before this.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc06/O06Thrall04.m.transcription: Karen, what are you doing here?

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc06/O06Thrall06.m.transcription: Those pink skins are called humans. They are our enemies from across the sea. They seem intent on keeping us from the peak.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc06/O06Thrall15.m.transcription: Quickly, my warriors! The wyverns must be freed!

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc06/O06Thrall22.m.transcription: Hmm. That's the young sorceress Grom told me about. It appears that she seeks the Oracle as well.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc06/O06Thrall24.m.transcription: Hmm, don't worry, Cairn. I was raised by the humans. I know their tricks and strategies. There's no way that I'll let them stop me from reaching the Oracle.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc07/O07Cairne01.m.transcription: The path cuts off in different directions.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc07/O07Cairne03.m.transcription: Very well. Be careful, young one. There's no telling what ancient creatures lie within the mountain's depths.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc07/O07Cairne21.m.transcription: The statues are coming to life! Defend yourselves!

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc07/O07Cairne24.m.transcription: The spiked pit is filled with quill bars. It looks as if they're protecting some kind of gemstone.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc07/O07Cairne25.m.transcription: This must activate the trap mechanism.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc07/O07Cairne27.m.transcription: The gemstone has an inscription on its base. Ah, this is the spirit stone of stone talon chasm. If the legends are true, then this will activate the spirit bridge that leads to the oracle.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc07/O07Cairne28.m.transcription: If the legends are correct, then this should be the Spirit's bridge. But the Spirit's stone that powers it has been lost. Perhaps we should return to the Quilbor's pit and retrieve the gemstone we saw there.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc07/O07Cairne32.m.transcription: Ah, the Spirit's Bridge. Just as the legends described it. Now, young Warchief, the path to the Oracle is revealed.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc07/O07FootmanA08.transcription: I've had it with skulking in these caves.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc07/O07FootmanA22.transcription: Let's get the hell out of here!

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc07/O07Jaina34.mp.transcription: Orcs. I knew that we were being followed. Defend yourselves!

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc07/O07Medivh35.m.transcription: Stop! There will be no violence in this place.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc07/O07Medivh37.m.transcription: Very perceptive son of Durotan, I am the prophet. And now that I have lured you all here, I will tell you what destiny holds.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc07/O07Sorceress0.transcription: He's fairly bright for an orc.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc07/O07Statue14.m.transcription: I am a Zoom, ancient princess of the Moon children. None may pass until my heart is returned to me.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc07/O07Thrall02.m.transcription: Hm. Either of those caverns could stretch for miles. Perhaps we should split up.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc07/O07Thrall05.m.transcription: Hmm, that's strange. I don't recall seeing any sheep in this land.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc07/O07Thrall12.m.transcription: Those harpies have nearly killed that wretched creature. It looks as if they're after its treasure. Kill them all, and we'll take what's left for ourselves.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc07/O07Thrall13.m.transcription: Hmm, the great beast was protecting a magical amulet. I'd better hold on to this.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc07/O07Thrall15.m.transcription: The statue's magic has created an impassable barrier. I wonder what it means by its heart.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc07/O07Thrall16.m.transcription: Here is your heart, Ajun. Now, grant us passage to the Oracle.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc07/O07Thrall18.m.transcription: Hmm, apparently this is some kind of spectral bridge. But the enchanted gemstone that powers it is missing. With any luck, care and we'll find it for us.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc07/O07Thrall36.m.transcription: That voice, you know Oracle, you're the prophet.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc07Interlude/O07J.transcription: Unite with them, are you mad?
Wait, this is insane. You can't possibly expect me to...

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc07Interlude/O07M.transcription: Thrall, this is Jaina Proudbor, leader of the survivors of Lordaeron.

The invasion of the Burning Legion has begun. Lordaeron has already fallen, and now the demons come to invade Kalimdor. Only together, united against the shadow, will you be able to save this world from the flame.

Have you heard nothing that I've said? The Legion comes to undo history and end all life. Thrall, your friend Hellscream has already fallen under the Demon's influence. Soon he and your whole race will be lost forever.
Then you must rescue him immediately. He is the key to the destiny I promised you. However, you will need help.
Destiny is at hand, young sorceress. The time to choose has come. For the fate of all who live, humanity must join forces with the Horde.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc07Interlude/O07T.transcription: What the hell is going on here?
Survivors! What are you talking about?
No. I'll die before I let that happen.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc08/O08Cairne01.m.transcription: If the Prophet was correct, then the war song encampment lies just over the ridge. We should ready ourselves for battle.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc08/O08Cairne06.m.transcription: The spirits rage around you, young warchief. May sense your anguish, your grief.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc08/O08ChaosOrc08.transcription: You are the human's lapdog. We serve only the Legion now.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc08/O08Grom26.mp3.transcription: And where would you lead me, boy? Destiny is at hand. Lord Maneroth is our master now.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc08/O08Grom28.mp3.transcription: "Ah, thrall. You always believed that the demons corrupted our race, but that's only half true. We gave ourselves up willingly on Draenor. The other chieftains and I, we drank Maneroth's blood thrall. We brought this curse upon ourselves.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc08/O08Grom30.mp3.transcription: "Ha! You'll have to do better than that, little brother!"

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc08/O08Grom33.mp3.transcription: Thrall, I see clearly now. I'm... sorry. I am so sorry.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc08/O08Grom35.mp3.transcription: Maneroth. We must face Maneroth in the canyon.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc08/O08Jaina03.mp.transcription: Just remember Thrall. With this Soul Gem, you can capture your friend Hellscream's spirit without hurting him. But you need to bring it back to my base immediately so we can free Grom from the Demon's control.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc08/O08Jaina05.mp.transcription: That makes two of us. I'll return to my base and aid you as best I can. Good luck. Oh. Gentlemen.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc08/O08Jaina09.mp.transcription: We're under heavy attack, we need help immediately.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc08/O08Jaina10.mp.transcription: The demons are back. Send reinforcements quick.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc08/O08Jaina11.mp.transcription: We're being overrun. Help us, please.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc08/O08Jaina22.mp.transcription: They're all. The skies are burning.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc08/O08Thrall02.m.transcription: I know, Ken. It's just that I never thought I'd live to see the day when I had to fight my own people.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc08/O08Thrall04.m.transcription: I appreciate your help, Miss Proudmoore. Yet another day I thought I'd never live to see.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc08/O08Thrall07.m.transcription: "El Scream" is like a brother to me, Cairn. But he and his clan have fallen under the demon's influence. If I can't save him, then my people might be damned for all time.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc08/O08Thrall23.m.transcription: This is no natural storm. Blessed ancestors, everyone brace yourselves!

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc08/O08Thrall24.m.transcription: Fight on, my warriors! We must reach Hellscream before it's too late!

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc08/O08Thrall25.m.transcription: Grom, you've got to come with me!

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc08/O08Thrall29.m.transcription: You did this, to our people. Knowingly?

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc08/O08Thrall31.m.transcription: Ah, spirits help me. We'll have to go back and try to capture Hellscream again.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc08/O08Thrall34.m.transcription: To hell with your apologies. Right now, I need you to help me save our people.

Dialogue/OrcCampaign/Orc08/O08Thrall36.m.transcription: Then let's go. I don't want to keep the bastard waiting.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest00x/D00Grunt.transcription: You've got the look of an ogre half-breed. What's your business here?

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest00x/D00Mogri.transcription: Come, you mongrels. Taste the steel of mongering jacks.
I know. This would be a good death, if not for my failure.
I was to deliver a crucial report to my chieftain in the lands below. But now...
I have failed him, and I have lost my honor.
How come I'll show you? Thank you. Seek out the city of Orgrimmar. Find Warchief Thrall. Tell him.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest00x/D00Rexxa.transcription: I have wandered alone for many years, Little Misha. Yet sometimes even I grow weary of this endless solitude.
I have watched the other races. I have seen their squabbling, their ruthlessness, their wars do nothing but scar the land, and drive the wild things to extinction.
No, they cannot be trusted. Only beasts are above deceit.
Hold fast, stranger, you shall not stand alone.
Your stomach's been split open. I can do little to ease your pain.
I will deliver your message, old one. For the sake of honor, I will uphold your charge."
May the winds bear you swiftly to your ancestors, warrior.
Well, Mischa, it seems we'll be seeing civilization after all. Let's get moving.
A warrior city. I have not seen its like in many years.
I carry a message for your war chief. I'll not stay long.
A moment, Warchief. I come to deliver a message.
He fell in the wilds. His last wish was that you receive this message.
I am Rexar. Last son of the Moknathol.
Perhaps I have spent too long in the wilds. Your offer is kind, Thrall. But I must carry my own weight. Just show me what needs doing, and I'll earn my keep.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest00x/D00Thral.transcription: Show up those supports. When the razor winds kick up again, they'll tear those roofs right off.
How did you come by this report? Where is Mogren?

"Maknathar, I've heard tales of your people. They had both orc and ogre blood in their veins. It is an honor. We've built this kingdom, Duratar, for all of our kind. Duratar is as much your home as it is mine, Rexar. Stay a while. Accept what hospitality we can offer. It is the least we can do.
Hmm, I understand. Founding a nation is tired of some work, and there are many around here that can use your help. Simply talk to them, and they will point you in the right direction.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest01x/D01Blood.transcription: It was foolish of you to come here. We are not afraid of you, Orcs. We won't let you chase us out of our lands.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest01x/D01Nazgr.transcription: Greetings Warrior. I am Nazgru, Captain of the War Chief Security Force. We've been having problems with the indigenous creatures attacking our borders. Perhaps you can help.
The harpies of the northern foothills have been ransacking our supply-care events for weeks. If you can find their lair and put an end to their rampage, I'll see to it that you're rewarded.
Time is short, warrior. You must destroy the harpies before they attack another caravan.
Ah, the caravans are safe at last. You've done well, warrior. The horde owes you a great debt. Go to the armory down the way and tell them I sent you. They'll give you a choice of exotic items.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest01x/D01Rexxa.transcription: This must be one of the caravans Nazgirl told me about.
I never intended to chase you out. I intend to bury you here.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest02x/D02DrekT.transcription: Ah, you're one of the Makhnathol. I am Driktha. I fought alongside your elders on Draenor many years ago. Still, if you've come to help, I do have a simple task for you.

I've been concocting a special potion that will aid our warriors in battle. However, I'm seeing a key ingredient. I require shimmerweed. But the rare herb can only be found in the valley known as Thunder Ridge.

Normally I would gather the herbs myself, but the thunder lizards from whom the valley is named have become increasingly hostile of late. If you retrieve six bushels for me, I will reward you handsomely.
Back so soon, where the thunder is it's too much for you lad?
Hmm. It sounds like something. Or someone is riling up those lizards. I'll look into it myself. Well, at least my potion is complete. Here, take a few vials of it. It'll serve you well.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest02x/D02Rexxa.transcription: Thunder ridge. This must be the valley Drexthar spoke of. This shouldn't be too difficult.
This must be the shimmer read. I'll need to gather five more bushels.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest03x/D03Gazlo.transcription: Ugh, new guy, huh? I'm Gazlo, chief engineer around these parts. But enough about me. We got work to do, buddy.

You see, me and my boys have been dredging out tunnels beneath the city, looking for underground wells. Problem is, we dug straight into a den of cobalt. Now those rat freaks are running willy nearly all over our tunnels.
I need you to hook up with my boys and seal those cobalt back in their hole. Yeah, just find the tunnel entrance outside of town and my boys will set you straight.
Hey, come on pal. I'm not peeing you by the hour.
So they blew themselves up, you see. Now that's occupational commitment. Anyway, you're done good, kid. Take these items. It's the least I can do to repay you.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest03x/D03Rexxa.transcription: You're not paying me at all, little goblin.
This must be the entrance to the Goblin's tunnels.
Do your goblins have a plan?
This must be one of the support beams. It's all yours, goblins.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest03x/D03Sappe.transcription: Wow, you're a big one! Gaslow City be sending some muscle!
Of course! If you can get us close enough to the tallest abort beams, we'll blast them to smithereens! Thought you'd collapse the ceiling on top of those rats and fix our problem up real nice!

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest04Ax/D04AThr.transcription: Ahh, thrum ka rexar. The others tell me you've been a great help to them. I appreciate all you've done for us.
This is Rokan of the dark spear tribe. He is one of my best scouts.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest06Ax/D06ADre.transcription: Ah, Rexha, I'm glad you're here. I've been studying the Thunderlizards for some time. The creatures almost never leave this valley, but lately they've been migrating out in greater numbers. As you've seen, they've also become highly aggressive.
Something must be riling them up. Let's investigate the ridge and see if we can find any clues. Oh, and if you find any of their eggs, I'd love to study them.
We allied with the humans at the Battle of Mount Haizhou. Our two races have been at peace ever since. Still, it's strange that they would venture so far into our lands.

No, our war chief signed a non-aggression pact with the humans, destroying their holdings could lead us to open war. For now we must put the raging lizards down before they cause any more harm. We'll have to deal with the humans later.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest06Ax/D06AFoo.transcription: Look, more orcs. Our intelligence was right. We best head back to base and report.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest06Ax/D06ARex.transcription: These tracks indicate that the lizards came through this pass. I'm curious as to where it leads.
Apparently many of the Thunderlizards came from the secluded valley. I wonder what could have driven them out.
Humans. What could they be doing here?
A human lumber mill. They've cut down all of the trees. That's got to be what's driving the Thunderlizards mad. We should destroy the mill immediately.
The poor beasts have been slain. What a terrible waste of life. We should report back to Thrall. He'll need to know what the humans are doing out here.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest06Ax/D06AThr.transcription: Looking for Drexthar? Before he left, he said something about investigating the lizards out near Thunder Ridge. If you hurry, you might catch up to him.
I'm sorry, Rexar. I still haven't heard from the old shaman.
You say the humans were deforesting Thunder Ridge? What could Jaina be thinking? It's not like her to be so reckless. I'll look into this matter, Rexar. You have my word.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest06Bx/D06BDre.transcription: Ah, well done, lad. Studying these eggs will help me understand the Thunderlizards ecology. They could be the key to ensuring that nothing like this ever happens again.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest07Ax/D07AGar.transcription: Throw 'em cow warrior! We haven't seen any signs of human activity, but the local quill bores have been getting bolder. There is an observatory nearby that helps us spot potential threats. You might want to check it out. But be warned, the quill bores roam the entire area. Go, gosh! If only there was a way to root them out, we could end their threat once and for all.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest07Ax/D07ANaz.transcription: Thromcar XR. I spoke to Thrall about the humans encroaching on our lands. I for one don't trust them at all. I'd like you to report to our outlying watch post and meet with my lieutenant, Garthok. I need to know if they've spotted any suspicious activity along the border.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest07Ax/D07ARex.transcription: Now I can activate the telescope and survey the surrounding lands.
Blast! It looks like the beginnings of an invasion. There's far too many of them for me to handle alone.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest07Ax/D07AThr.transcription: Are you certain of what you saw, Rexar? I can't imagine that Jaina would send troops so close to our border. This does not bode well at all. Packed or no packed, I won't allow anything to jeopardize the security of our nation.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest07Bx/D07BRex.transcription: This must be the entrance to the Quillbor's den. It smells foul enough. I don't even want to imagine what they're cooking in there.
It appears that they worship some kind of primitive bore God. Interesting.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest08x/D08Footm.transcription: Orcs! We've been followed! To Arms, men! To Arms!

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest08x/D08Nazgr.transcription: I heard about the human ship, SWAT chief. What are your orders?
What if they're hostile, War Chief?
The human scum will pay dearly for this. Blood for blood. Life for life, no tarogaar!
Come human dogs, taste the wrath of the horde.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest08x/D08Rexxa.transcription: "No, we're too late. The camp's already been raised. There are human tracks everywhere. They lead back towards the coast."
No doubt about it. Those are the same ships I saw from the Observatory.
This anchor emblem on the shields. Have you ever seen it before?

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest08x/D08Rokha.transcription: pardon boss man, but if the humans be coming from the sea, my tribe on the Echo Isles could be deep in the danger too.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest08x/D08Thral.transcription: I want you both to head back to that watch post and keep an eye on the humans. We can't let this situation escalate out of control.
I'd prefer that the humans remain unharmed, but if they prove hostile in any way, you have my permission to slaughter them.
You did all you could, my warriors. Above all else you kept Durotar safe. Yet this anger sigil you described does seem oddly familiar. I just can't place it.
Don't worry, Rokhan. You have my word that I won't let anything happen to your people.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest09Ax/D09ARex.transcription: There's no telling what dangers lurk on these isles. I'll have to move quickly and find the Trolls Village.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest09Ax/D09AThr.transcription: I have an urgent mission for you, Rexar. That human fleet poses a serious threat to the trolls that live on the Echo Isles. I need you to take a Zeppelin to the Isles and warn the trolls about what's happening. If you can, try to convince them to join us on the mainland.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest09Ax/D09AVol.transcription: I be Vol'jin, leader of the dark spear tribe. It be good that the watch you've seen do when he did man. Our village is already be under attack by the human fleet. We got no time to waste.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest09Bx/D09BRex.transcription: You have little chance of defeating such a force on your own, Vol'jin. You shall evacuate your tribe to the mainland and unite with the War Chief's forces.
I have no flying mount, Vol'jin. I'll be useless on land.
We have no flying mounts, Bulgin. We'll be useless on land.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest09Bx/D09BVol.transcription: Even now, the humans' battleships be blasting away at a coast of villages.
Though I hate to be abandoned in our homes, your plan be a wise one. However, we got to destroy those battleships before the evacuation can begin.
Oh, these wily ones will serve you well, man. The talent for destruction be mighty.
Oh, won't be a problem, man. Now, this be feeling a bit strange.
We never you want to get your legs back. Just land in the ritual circle. Remember, you must destroy at least five of the human ships before we can commence with the evacuation.
There'll be no time to go around here, Warrior. Those battleships need to be destroyed.
Well done, man. You saved my tribesmen. The outer villages be ready for the evacuation. They wait only the signal to begin.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest09Cx/D09CRex.transcription: Damn, the bracer is guarded by some kind of sea giant. Getting to it won't be as easy as I thought.
Whoa, he's a big one. I'm in for a serious fight.
I love to fight my way past that beast.
That vile creature stands in my way.
I hate to see any beast harmed, but there is no other way.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest09Cx/D09CVol.transcription: In order to signal their evacuation, you gotta light the five signal braziers scattered across the islands. When you're done, the rest of me tribe will set sail for the mainland. But be careful man, they'll be more dangerous force than humans prowling the jungle.
You gotta hurry, man. The human fleet be drawing near.
The evacuation be underway, Rexar. When we reach the mainland, we be building our own village south of your border. For what you've done this day, the dark spear hunters be always in your debt.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest10x/D10Emiss.transcription: What is the meaning of this? This... ogre cannot be the orc war chief?
Jaina, why would you think she would be- ugh, enough of this drivel. We'd hope to corner your wretched war chief, but you will have to suffice. Strike!
Foolish beast, you have no idea what's coming for you. It is only just beginning.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest10x/D10Grunt.transcription: Look, Tarexar! The warchief said you might need help!

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest10x/D10Rexxa.transcription: I don't know, Thrall. It sounds like a trap to me. Let me go in your place.
Just trust me. If you're right, we'll have lost nothing.
Worried. Bye. I'm just biting my time.
This is it. The meeting plays lies just beyond.
Greetings, humans. It's about time you showed up.
And you are not gonna proud more.
Assassins! I knew this was a trap!
You're just in time, brothers. I saved a few of them for you.
Tell me who sent you, human. Was it Gina?

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest10x/D10Thral.transcription: I'm glad you returned safely, Rexar. You've done well. My scouts have informed me that the dark spear trolls have landed further down the coast. They'll be much safer under the Horde's protection.
Still, the situation with the humans has intensified. I've received word that they're sending an emissary to parlay with me. We're to meet at Razor Hill around midnight.
I can't imagine that Jaina Proudmoore would ever set me up, Rexar. Even so. I'm not one to run from a fight.
Getting cold feet already? I thought you weren't worried.
You were right, Drexar. I should have trusted your instincts. Still, I can't believe Jaina would try something like this. Hm, perhaps it's time we took a more direct approach.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest11x/D11Rexxa.transcription: You can count on me, Thrall, but I may need help bypassing the humans' defenses.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest11x/D11Thral.transcription: Rexar, I've written the letter to Jaina Proudmoore asking her to account for all this madness. I want you to infiltrate her base on Theramore Isle and deliver it to her, personally.
I've chartered this Zeppelin to take you to the Dark Spirit Tribe's new village. Once you get there, Vol'jin will see that you get all the help you'll need.
Good luck, Rexar. The future of Durotar is in your hands.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest12x/D12Jaina.transcription: What are you talking about? I do not seek Thrall's death, nor do I have any intention of betraying the pact we made.
I assure you, I ordered no such attacks. Lead me to these troops, Rexar. I want to see them for myself.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest12x/D12Rexxa.transcription: Jaina Proudmoore, I am Rexar. I bear a message from War Chief Thrall, the same War Chief you tried to kill. He is curious as to why your warriors encroach on our lands and threaten us with war.
Perhaps. But the fact remains that your ships in your warriors have been raiding our encampments on the mainland. I had to bypass a large encampment just to reach you.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest12x/D12Samur.transcription: "Throm car, brother, I am Samuro. My humble skills are yours. Vol'jin entrusted me with a batch of explosive wards filled with an unstable concoction. If I can place them on some critical structures, I could create enough of a distraction to allow you to sneak across the channel in this boat."
I am ready to try again. They won't even see me coming this time.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest12x/D12Volji.transcription: Greetings, man. My tribe be honored by your visit, though I know you got big matters to be attending to. Sneaking onto Theramor, I'll be no easy task. Luckily, there'll be one who can help you. He waits for you by the shipyard to reach him, follow the road out of town.
We heard reports that the human fleet patrols the channel between the mainland and Theramor Isle. Beware Iman, they could stand between you and the sorceress you seek.
Haven't reached there anymore yet? You'd best be hurrying warrior. You gotta deliver the message soon.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest13x/D13Dying.transcription: Mr. Stina, we found you at last. The Admiral will be overjoyed.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest13x/D13Jaina.transcription: Rexar? Those don't look like humans to me.
Well, we won't find any answers waiting around here. Let's move.
Yes, but these tracks lead out to sea. Look there, that tiny island.
Is it even possible? We've got to get back to Theramore immediately.
Just trust me, Rexor. I'll explain when we get there.
Hopefully we've made it in time. You've got to get word back to Thrall that
Those Marines. I know who they are XR.
The Horde is no longer our enemy. The orcs have their own kingdom now, we...
I won't let you do it, Father. You don't understand.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest13x/D13Naga0.transcription: More surface to where there is. Destroy them!
Intruders! Slutter them before they escape!

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest13x/D13Proud.transcription: Jaina, bless the stars I found you at last. When I heard that Lordaeron fell, I despaired. But I knew you'd find a way to escape. What is this? An ogre?

You have always been naive, my daughter. You aren't old enough to remember what these monsters did to our homeland. The orcs in their kin cannot be trusted. They must be exterminated like the Mongrels they are.
I understand more than you suspect, my dear. Perhaps in time you will too. Seize them all!

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest13x/D13Rexxa.transcription: Those snake creatures! They must have destroyed the camp and slaughtered your brethren!
Strange. I don't see any human bodies strewn around.
The serpent's lair must be around here somewhere. If we can find the human survivors, we'll confirm whether or not they serve your cause.
We're too late. The serpents already killed them all.
I don't understand. What's this all about?

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest14x/D14Rexxa.transcription: I've got to get out of here and warn Thrall about Admiral Proudmoore. There are a number of small ships in the harbor. If I can come into you and I should be able to reach the open seas unnoticed.
This should do nicely. Now all I have to worry about are the harbor gates.
Proud moors, Marines, have closed the harbor gates. I'll need to bust them open before I can escape. If I can make it to the open seas, I should have no problem reaching the mainland.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest14x/D14Volji.transcription: I'm glad you escaped, Rexha. And don't worry, we'll send word to Thrall about the Admiral's fleet. If that human's planning on attacking Duratar, you'll find the warriors of the Horde ready to greet him.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest15Ax/D15ACai.transcription: Who are you, Traveler? Why have you come here?
I am kin, but I can be of help to no one. Return to your warchief and tell him that I am dead, just as my heart is dead.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest15Ax/D15ARex.transcription: This beautiful land must be Mulgore. I have never met a Torin before, but the strength and courage are legendary.
I come in the name of Thrall, Warchief of the Horde. His lands are in danger, and he calls upon his old allies to aid him. I seek the one known as Cairn. Do you know him?

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest15Ax/D15ATag.transcription: The barbarous centaur attacked our village recently. Our chieftains only son, Bane, was taken captive. The centaur are cannibals and do not keep prisoners for long. We searched everywhere for a sign that Bane was still alive, but we found no trace of him.
The chieftain prayed to the Earth Mother for peace and guidance, but at fear he has given into his grief and despair.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest15Ax/D15AVol.transcription: It'd be taking the warchief some time to amass the Horde's warriors. You gotta gather what allies you can find before the admiral mixes move against Durotar.
Take this Zeppelin and travel to Malgore. The mighty Torren who be living there will lend what help they can. Seek out the chieftain Cairn of Bloodhoof. He will honor his oath to the war chief.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest15Bx/D15BRex.transcription: rotting codo husks. What a terrible waste. The harpies will pay for this sacrilege of nature!

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest15Bx/D15BTag.transcription: With cairn grieving as he is, many of our enemies have been gaining a foothold in our lands. The vicious harpies of the Stone Talon Mountains have been poaching our precious codo herds.

The codos meet and hides are essential to our survival, but the harpies slaughter the beasts and leave their carcasses to rot in the sun. It would be a great help if you would hunt the witches down and end their poaching once and for all.
We are in your debt, warrior. The harpies will not trouble us again for many seasons. Still, I fear that without our chieftains leadership, our tribe's prosperity will fade.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest15Cx/D15CCai.transcription: "Bain, my son. I thought I'd lost you forever. I was an old fool to despair. Rexha, by returning my son to me, you have given me new life. For that I will ever be grateful."

Now, you said that your War Chief was in trouble, that the Horde needed the Torrin once again. Well, Thrall did much for us in his time, and we will not fail him. My warriors will rendezvous with the War Chief upon the battlefield, but I will be returning with you.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest15Cx/D15CRex.transcription: Greetings, brother Windotum. I was told you could help me locate Chieftain Bloodhoof's son. There may still be a chance that the boy lives, but we'll need to find the centaur encampment as quickly as possible.
That's the Centaur encampment. They could be keeping Bane in one of those cages, but we'll have to fight our way to them.
Don't worry, Bane. We'll have you back to your father in no time.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest15Cx/D15CTag.transcription: Poor Kan has been lethargic for some time. Without his wisdom and leadership, I fear that the centaur will decimate our tribe. Perhaps if you could find some clue as to his son's fate, it might rouse the chieftain from his stupor.
Find Bovin Wind Totem out on the plains. He and his brethren will aid you on your search.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest16Ax/D16AKor.transcription: You fight good half-breed. You maknathaw. Half-weak orc blood invains. Still, you strong. Why you come here?
You got some overblood. You got right to join. But do you got the strength? We see halfbreed. We see.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest16Ax/D16AOgr.transcription: Must help, new O Lord, conquer clan, kill many warriors, lead clan to ruin. Brothers, not survive. Me, seek help.
You know welcome, half-breed. You know Stonewall Warrior.
You want to talk cordol? You get past us!

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest16Ax/D16ARex.transcription: New warlord, huh? Don't worry, friend. I think I can help you. Have your witch doctors tend to his wounds, Vol'jin. I'm going to pay a little visit to his clan and meet this new warlord for myself.
That must be the ogre's village. I should fit right in.
Look, I don't want any trouble. I just want to talk with your warlord.
I've come to join your clan. I want to be a stone ball too.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest16Ax/D16AVol.transcription: Ah, you returned just in time, Rexar. Our scouts found this wounded organ near the borderlands. Despite his wounds, he came all the way here seeking help.
Our Olga friend be recovered in Swiftly Rexha, but I thought you were heading out to his village. Your best be hurrying.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest16Bx/D16BKor.transcription: So, you want to join the storm on clan? First, you take trial of strength. Need to find the gauntlet. House Valley full of big foes, slave foes, run the gauntlet. That proves strength to us. Go now half-breed. We'll see if you'll return.
Ah, you scared of gauntlet half-breed? I knew you not strong enough.
You got strength after all half-breed. You're worthy to be Stonewall. Now you in. What you want from clan.
*laughing* Stupid half-breed, we ogres spit from horde long ago. They weak, soft, we know owe them nothing. Long as I rule, stone malls no help no orcs.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest16Bx/D16BRex.transcription: This must be the valley Korgal spoke of. The gauntlet, he called it. Well, I'd better get this over with. I'd hate to keep the brute waiting.
I want you and your warriors to help the Horde battle the humans. The Stonewall Clan would be a great asset to the Ork War Chief.
Then perhaps you've ruled long enough.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest16Cx/D16CKor.transcription: Me had no real challenge in long time half breed. Breaking you be fun. We both take trial of blood. Me and you. No tricks, no magic toys. Just muscle and skills.
You think we're dumb? You think we're slow? Now you see why Korgal rules clan.
Come back when you get strong. Maybe challenge me again.
