Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest16Cx/D16COgr.transcription: Ricks on, Ricks on, Ricks on, Ricks on, Ricks on!
♪ Red song ♪ ♪ Red song ♪ ♪ Red song ♪ ♪ Red song ♪

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest16Cx/D16CRex.transcription: Corgall, as a member of the Stonewall Clan, I claim the right to challenge you for leadership.
I underestimated Korgal's skills. I'll need to call upon my beasts to defeat him.

I have defeated Korgol in single combat. I have passed the Trial of Blood. I ruled Stonewall Clan now, and I command you all to war. You oogers arm yourselves and meet the orc war chief upon the plains. Blood and glory to the Stonewall Clan.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest16Cx/D16CVol.transcription: You be tougher than I imagined, Rexha. The Ogres be a great help when the battle begins. We just get word that the Warchief and his forces set up the command post in the central basin. The tauren and Ogres you gathered going to be joining them soon.
Checking with Thrall at his base. The battle against Admiral Proudmoore's forces could start up at any time.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest17x/D04BThra.transcription: Once again, you have done the whole to great service, Rexar. I am in your debt.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest17x/D17Rexxa.transcription: Of course, Thrall. I'd be proud to.
I've secured the first component, but I've got to hurry and get the others. Time is running out.
That's it. I've got all of them. I'd better get these back to Thrall quickly.
It is an honor, War Chief. I will carry your standard with pride. Look Taro Gar!

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest17x/D17Thral.transcription: Your efforts may have saved us all, Rexar. The yogurt and tauran conscripts you've rallied could turn the tide in our favor. Proudmoore's forces have established a stronghold due north of our position. Our scouts report that he's mobilized all of his standing forces for an attack on Duratar.

If you're willing, there's one last thing I need before the hammer falls. We've crafted a new standard for Doratar, a mighty banner bearing the symbol of the Horde. I want to place a shamanistic blessing on it, but I require a few items to complete my spell. Would you gather them for me?
You've got to hurry, Rexar. I want our standard flying high when we meet the humans head on.
These are perfect, Rexar. Just let me finish this spell.
There, the blessing is complete. One last thing, Rexar. I want you to carry our standard into battle. I hereby name you Champion of the Horde.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest18x/D18Rexxa.transcription: Gladly. All right, you warriors. The hour of victory has arrived. Come, you Torren. Rise up, you ogres. Today, you stand united with the Horde. Look, Torogor!
Strike hard warriors! Push the humans back!
Slay the invaders! Let none survive!
The human lines are breaking. Now it's our time to strike.
Throm car, war chief. We've routed the human forces on the mainland, but it appears that Admiral Proudmoore and his Marines have pulled back to the safety of Theramor Isle.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest18x/D18Rokha.transcription: "Watch if Admiral Proudmo's forces have begun their advance. They'll be here any moment."

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest18x/D18Thral.transcription: Let them come. They'll find the horde to be more than they bargained for. Rexar, you've earned the honor of drawing first blood. I'll hold the defenses here, but I want you to lead the attack against Proudmoore's base.
I wish this was the end of it, Rexar. But so long as Admiral Proudmore lives, he'll never stop hounding us. We must press our attack, and lay siege to Theramore itself.
I only pray that Jaina is safe. She had nothing to do with her father's agenda, but unfortunately, invading her citadel is the only option we have left.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest19x/D04ARexx.transcription: This village has been raised. There's no evidence that the clan survived at all.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest19x/D04ARokh.transcription: There be hoof prints everywhere. This must be the work of the center.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest19x/D04BCent.transcription: We cling orcs, no real lesson. This land belong to us forever.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest19x/D04BMath.transcription: The Rumpkar warrior. I knew the warchief would not forsake us. You've got to kill the centakhan and take his iron key. It's the only thing that can open these blasted cages.
Thank you, warrior. Now that my clan is safe, we will begin our march to Orgrimmar. Tell the chieftain we will join him soon.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest19x/D19Jaina.transcription: "Thraw. Rexar. I come in peace. You must believe me. I had no part in my father's plans. I wish none of this had ever happened. I... I don't know what to do."
I know, Thrall. Do what you must. There is a goblin shipyard on a nearby island that could provide you with warships of your own. With those you could scatter the blockade surrounding Theramore.
But please spare my men if you can. My father will try to use them against you, but they're the only real family I'll have left when this is over. Please do this for me.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest19x/D19Rexxa.transcription: "Warchief, our troops are ready. But the admirals assemble the blockade of battleships around Theramore. There's no way we can match their firepower."
Our force is already thrown. It's now or never.
There! The goblin shipyard Gina spoke of! Now we can hire the Juggernaut to help us break the blockade!
The blockade is broken. Board the transports quickly. We must land on Theramore and crush the admiral's defenses.
Janus warriors are attacking. Remember our oath to her. Defend yourselves against them, but spare their structures.
Thank you, War Chief. Now only one task remains. We must storm the Citadel and deal with Admiral Proudmoore once and for all.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest19x/D19Thral.transcription: Damn it, I should have thought of this sooner. We've got to find some way to...

We've bled together on many battlefields, Jaina. We've faced untold perils as allies. But your father threatens the security of our nation and the very future of my people. You know how this has to end.
We'll do all we can, Jaina. You have my word. Now you'd better make yourself scarce. The battle's about to begin.
See ya done, Rexar. I'll meet you with Theramore.
You've done well, Rexar. You're a natural leader. You remind me of Hellscream in a way.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest20x/D20Cairn.transcription: We are with your Exar. Lead on!

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest20x/D20Proud.transcription: I must admit, you orcs are more tenacious than I remembered. I thought you savages would have turned on each other by now.

Can your blood atone for genocide, orc? Your horde killed countless innocents with its rampage across Stormwind and Loderon. Do you really think you can just sweep all that away and cast aside your guilt so easily? No, your kind will never change, and I will never stop fighting you.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest20x/D20Rexxa.transcription: "Look door over for the horde! For Dorota!"
The admirals elite guard are trying to cut us off. Slay them all!
Above all else, Deena. He was a proud warrior. Remember him as such.

I appreciate your offer, Thrall, but I am Moknathal, a wanderer. I belong in the wild amidst the beasts and elements of the land, but know this, brother. I will always be a part of the horde. I will always be there when you need me. Farewell."

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/OrcQuest20x/D20Thral.transcription: Now warriors, we must storm the Citadel. We must find Admiral Proudmoore and put an end to him. Only then will our nation be safe.
This is not the horde you remember, old man. We have no interest in conquest or murder. We have paid for the sins of our forebears, in blood.
Durotar is now safe. We have no further quarrel with these humans. We will leave your aisle in peace, Jaina. I pray we never have to come here again. Farewell, sorceress.
You saved our nation, Rexar. For that I can never repay you. Will you return to Duratar with us and make a new home for yourself?

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/RandomOrcQuest01x/DR.transcription: Listen, stranger, for my time is short. We shaman were attacked by a band of renegade warlocks. Our own king still loyal to the Burning Legion.

The warlocks stole one of our sacred artifacts, then fled back into the hills. No doubt they have a secret cover nearby. Then the ghosts of my murdered brethren can recover the stolen artifact. There's no telling what evil they might unleash with its power.
The ghosts of my brethren now lie silent. Thank you, warrior. You have read the world of a terrible evil. I feel my death approaching.
Take the artifact and the rest of our items. Use them to bring glory to the Horde. I will rest easier knowing that they lie in honorable hands.
This place reeks of evil. It must be where the warlocks are hiding.
An outsider. So I am brothers. Quickly.

Dialogue/OrcExpCamp/RandomOrcQuest02x/DR.transcription: Ah, greetings my friend. I am Chen Stormstout, humble brewmaster of Pandaria. I have travelled the wide world searching for rare exotic ingredients to use in my special brews. After all, good ale can solve all the problems of this world. Don't you agree?
Say, if you're free, I could use your help in locating some special ingredients for my latest brew. If you find the items on this list and bring them back to me, I'll let you sample my masterpiece.
"Ah, I see you've returned empty-handed. Don't be afraid, my friend. Strong ale should be nothing to fear for one of your sighs."
Perfect! Perfect! These are just what I needed! Here, try a sample of my latest creation!

Ah, perhaps it needs some refinement. After all, we must learn to crawl before we can run. Don't you agree? Well, now that my brew is complete, I can experience more of this strange, rugged land. Would you mind if I tagged along with you, Warrior?
Ah, my friend. I found that no path is too perilous when doused with strong drink. Off we go!
*cough* What the hell is that stuff? Are you trying to kill me?
Not at all, Chen, but my path is a perilous one.

Dialogue/TutorialCampaign/Tutorial01/T01.transcription: We are yours to command, Warchief.
War Chief, we've discovered a group of Merlock raiders in the nearby river.
It was not a nightmare, young warchief, but a vision. Follow me, and I will reveal what your future holds.
Greetings, son of Durotan. I knew you'd find your way.
I know many things, young warchief, about you and your people. My identity at this time is unimportant. What is important is that you rally your people and leave these shores immediately.

Human. I left my humanity behind long ago. I am something different now. Know that I have seen the future and beheld the great burning shadow that is coming to consume this world. You sense it as well, don't you?
Yes, and only by leading your people across the sea to the distant lands of Kalimdor, will you have a chance to stand against them.
I will answer all of your questions in time, Young War Chief. For now, rally your warriors and prepare to leave this land. We will speak again.
The blinking button at the top of the screen indicates that your Quest Journal has been updated. To find out more about your objectives, click on the Quest button.
First, select Thrall. To do this, left-click on Thrall in the main window.
Excellent. You seem eager to be on your way.
However, you must first learn how to give orders to Thrall.
Try ordering Thrall to move down the path towards the nearby banner. To do this, click the Move button in the bottom right corner of your screen and then click on the banner.
skillfully done. However, the ore encampment is still far off. In order to reach the next banner, scroll the screen to the north by moving your mouse to the top edge of the screen.
Very good. The path to the next banner leads through a black area. This black area represents terrain that has not been discovered yet.
Notice how the black area shrinks as Thrall moves through it. This reflects areas you have explored.
Select Thrall and order him to move to the banner in the middle of the encampment.
In order to have Thrall and his troops move together, you must first select all of them.
Now that your troops are all selected, order them to move to the next banner.
To order thralls forces to defeat this foul creature, select all of your troops, click on the attack button, and then click on the knoll.

Order your troops to perform an aggressive attack move into the enemy encampment. To do this, select all of your troops, click the attack button, and then left click on the ground in the middle of the knoll camp.
Good job. Notice that Thrall gained a level from the experience that he earned in combat. Only Heroes can acquire experience, allowing them to become incredibly powerful over time.
Heroes gain a hero point whenever they advance in level. These points can be used to acquire new abilities or to improve previously learned ones.
To spend Thrall's Hero Point, select him and click on the Hero Abilities button in the bottom right corner of your screen.
Whenever you click on the hero abilities button, the bottom right corner of your screen changes to show what abilities can be learned.
To spend Thrall's Hero Point and learn Chain Lightning, click on the Chain Lightning button in the bottom right corner of your screen.
The Murlox would make excellent targets for your new chain lightning spell. To have Thrall use his new ability, click on the chain lightning button and then left click on one of the Murlox.
Some monsters drop treasure when they are defeated. Treasure chests hold powerful magic items that can only be picked up by heroes such as Thrall.
This particular treasure chest contained a useful potion of mana. Notice that the potion now occupies one of Thrall's inventory slots near the bottom middle of your screen.
Potions of mana can be used to replenish a hero's mana, the magic energies that allow the casting of spells such as chain lightning.
Thrall is currently low on mana. Use the Potion of Mana to refresh Thrall and provide him with sufficient mana to cast additional spells.
Order Thrall's forces to explore up the river following the banners.
The Wolf Howl signifies that night has begun.
Excellent! Thrall has found a magic ring. Rings are very useful because they provide a constant passive benefit as long as they are carried.
Very good. That treasure chest held a magic tome that can be used to give thrall a permanent benefit.
What kind of nightmare was that?
I don't know what this is all about, but I'll play along.
LOKETAR MY WARRIORS!
Prepare yourselves. I sense a noal ahead.
Hmm. This was only a scout. But the Knowles camp lies just ahead.
Be wary, my warriors. Don't let Nightfall dull your senses.
An ogre. We'd have a fierce battle on our hands if the beast weren't sleeping.
Agalim, watch yourselves, my brethren. Those creatures do not sleep at night.
Forest trolls. I still can't believe they were ever a part of the Horde.
It was you I saw in the vision. Who are you? How do you know me?
Leave! What's this all about, human?
The demons are returning.
But how could we...
None of this makes sense, but the spirits tell me that I should trust him.

Dialogue/TutorialCampaign/Tutorial02/T02.transcription: You orcs are in violation of the Alliance Internment Act. We've already captured one of your leaders. If you surrender now, we'll spare your lives.
I'm fine, little brother. Luckily, they only injured my pride.
Finally, follow me. I have an idea.
Aha! We can set sail on the human's own ships!
War Chief, the clans are assembling as you ordered, but it will take them some time to reach us.
Yes, War Chief!
No war chief, we haven't heard from Hellscream in some time.
War Chief, they say they've captured one of our leaders. Maybe they're referring to Grom.
The wretched humans have been destroyed.
War Chief! We've found where they're holding Grom, but the area is protected by fortified guard towers.
The Horde is assembled, Warchief. We await only your command.
Now, go, young Thrall. Sail west to the lands of Kalimdor. It is there that you will find your destiny. It is there that your people's salvation will be assured.
In order to establish a base and recruit more troops, it is necessary to collect two different types of resources - gold and lumber.
To learn how to harvest gold, select a peon.
Pions can harvest gold from gold mines, such as the one located here.
To begin collecting gold, select your peon and right-click on the gold mine.
Once a peon has been ordered to harvest gold, he will automatically travel back and forth between the gold mine and your closest great haul.
Here are a few additional peons. To increase the rate of gold collection, order them to harvest from the same gold mine.
The amount of gold that you currently possess is displayed in the upper right portion of your screen. As peons return to your Great Hall with gold, your gold stockpile increases.
Now that your gold income is steady, you will want to produce additional peons to construct the rest of your base.
To train a peon, first select your Great Hall.
There is now a Train Pion button located in the command card near the bottom right corner of the screen. To begin training a Pion, simply click this button.
Training a unit takes time. When your Great Hall is selected, you can see a progress indicator in the bottom middle portion of your screen.
In order to support a larger population, additional orc burrows will have to be constructed. Burrows provide the food that allows you to train more troops.
To construct a burrow, select one of your peons.
Now click on the build structure button in the command card.
Notice that additional buttons are now available in the command card. To construct an Orc Burl, click on the Build Orc Burl button.
Now move the mouse to where you want the building to be placed.
Once you have found an appropriate location, left-click to begin construction.
Now that your burrow has been completed, the peon who built it can be assigned to a new task.
In order to produce additional buildings, you must gather more lumber from the nearby forests.
To harvest lumber, select a peon and right-click on a nearby tree.
Now that your peon has been assigned to gathered lumber, he will automatically travel back and forth between the forest and your closest great hall.
To increase the rate of which you collect lumber, train additional peons and assign them to harvest from the forest.
Well-placed warmills can increase the efficiency of your lumber harvesters. Try ordering a peon to construct a warmill near where your peons are chopping wood.
Warmills contain various upgrades that can be researched to improve your troops. To see what upgrades are available, select your Warmill.
All available upgrades appear as buttons in the Warmill's command card. To research an upgrade, left click on the one you want to purchase.
Congratulations! You have accumulated enough gold and lumber to construct a barracks. This will enable you to train additional troops for your army.
To construct a barracks, select a peon, click on the build structure button, and click on build barracks.
Now that your barracks is complete, you can begin training grunts to reinforce your army.
To train a grunt, first select your barracks.
Now click on the Train Grunt button in the command card.
Continue producing grunts until you reach your quest requirement.
Move thrall and the rest of your forces across the bridge and locate Grom.
One of your structures was damaged during the fight. To repair a damaged building, select a peon, click the repair button, and then left click on the desired structure.
Your army has grown to such a large size that it now requires a portion of your income to sustain it. This maintenance cost is referred to as upkeep.
You have just placed a rally point for your structure. Whenever a unit finishes training from this building, he will automatically travel to the rally points location.
To place a rally point, select one of your unit producing structures and right-click on the ground where you want the rally point to appear.
You have just garrisoned a peon in one of your burrows. This enables your peon to hurl spears at any enemies that come within range.

When you control multiple spellcasters at the same time, it often becomes necessary to quickly switch between them to cast their individual spells. By using the subgroup interface, you can do so without having to try to select them individually.

Notice that the currently selected units are displayed in the bottom middle portion of your screen by little portraits. One of the unit portraits is highlighted with the yellow glow. This means that it is the currently activated subgroup.
You can switch between subgroups by pressing the tab key or left clicking on one of the portraits that is not highlighted. This activates that subgroup and displays their spells in your command card.
It's been three days and this profit has yet to show himself. I hope I'm not making a huge mistake by trusting him.
Then we must prepare this camp immediately. I want my warriors to have food and proper lodgings when they arrive.
Warrior, has there been any word from Graham Hellscream? He and the War Song Clan were supposed to have been here by now.
Damn it, Grom. Where the hell are you?
I hope not. But if they have captured Hellscream, I'll make them regret it. Look taroga! Come, my warriors! We must drive the humans back!
Then destroy them! Hillstream must be freed!
Grom, are you alright?
Great, 'cause we're getting out of here now. We're leaving the human lands for good.
Perfect, but we'll need to wait for the rest of the horde.

Dialogue/UndeadCampaign/Undead01/U01Acol.transcription: Greetings, great lord. Our master, Kel'Thuzard, told us that you would come.
Be wary. If the townsfolk see your undead minions, they'll call the local guards to stop you.
Seek out the local graveyards. Those buried there will serve you well.
I live only to serve, great Lord.

Dialogue/UndeadCampaign/Undead01/U01Arth.transcription: Malganis! I don't know how you survived, but I will
Yes, I've damned everyone and everything I've ever loved in his name. And I still feel no remorse, no shame, no pity.
Then I'll make do without one. What is the Lich King's will?
Kelth is odd. How could he have known it?
I'm in luck. These graves were dug recently.
Arise in the name of the Lich King.
I cannot afford to lose any more acolytes.
Lodoron lies in ashes. What good are these cultists to us now?

Dialogue/UndeadCampaign/Undead01/U01Knig.transcription: How could you murder your own father?

Dialogue/UndeadCampaign/Undead01/U01Peas.transcription: The dead have risen again! Guards!

Dialogue/UndeadCampaign/Undead01/U01Tich.transcription: Calm yourself, Prince Arthur. I am Ticonderous. Like Morganus, I am a dreadlord. But I am not your enemy. In truth, I've come to congratulate you.
By killing your own father and delivering this land to the scourge, you have passed your first test. The Lich King is pleased with your enthusiasm.
The room blade that you carry was forged by the Lich King and empowered to steal souls. Yours was the first one it claimed.
The cult of the damned must be rallied once again. Many of the acolytes have been in hiding amongst the populace. Once you've rallied them, I will give you further instructions.
Well done, Death Knight. The cult is nearly assembled.
They will aid you in your next undertaking.
You will go to Underhall and recover the remains of the Akolite's former master. The Necromancer, Kel'thuzad.

Dialogue/UndeadCampaign/Undead02/U02Acol.transcription: This crude contraption will allow you to transport the remains of our master.
Pardon Lord, but a being of Kel'tu's odds power can only be reanimated at a nexus of powerful lay energies. And there are no such places in this land.

Dialogue/UndeadCampaign/Undead02/U02Arth.transcription: Can you not simply raise the remains when we find them?
Very well then. Let's move out.
Stand aside, brother. I've come to collect some old bones and I don't wish to be disturbed.
Come along now, Necromancer. The powers that you once served have need of you again.
Very dramatic, Uza. Give me the urn, and I'll make sure you die quickly.
I didn't know what it held. No does it matter. I'll take what I came for one way or another.
We may never know, Uther. I intend to live forever.
What the? Am I hearing ghosts now?

Dialogue/UndeadCampaign/Undead02/U02KelT.transcription: told you my death would mean little.
It is I, Kael'thuzad. I was right about you, Prince Arthas.
"Tell him nothing. Only you can hear me. The dreadlords cannot be trusted. They are the Lich King's jailers. I will tell you all when I walk this world again."

Dialogue/UndeadCampaign/Undead02/U02Necr.transcription: The undead must haunt the goldmine before the acolytes can begin harvesting gold.
Blight is created when undead structures are summoned. Buildings can only be summoned onto Blight with the exception of the Necropolis.
When standing on blight, wounded undead units regenerate faster.
Summoning a graveyard will supply the undead army with fresh corpses.
Ghouls harvest lumber for the undead army.

Dialogue/UndeadCampaign/Undead02/U02Pala.transcription: "Arthur, stop this madness before it's too late!"
I can't believe that we ever called you brother. I knew it was a mistake to accept a spoiled prince into our order. You've made a mockery of the silver hand.
Light have mercy on you. Your betrayal has broken Uther's heart, boy. He would have given his life for yours in a second, and this is how you repay his loyalty.

Vile betrayer, you are not fit enough to even carry your father's name. Why Uther ever vouched for you is beyond me. You stripped him of his honor by casting yours to the winds. You deserve a gruesome death boy.

Dialogue/UndeadCampaign/Undead02/U02Tich.transcription: Where are the necromancer's remains? Retrieve them immediately.
They took you long enough. These remains are badly decomposed. They will never survive the trip to Quelthalas.
Yes, only the energies of the High Elves Sunwell can bring Kofusard back to life.
You must steal a very special urn from the palletant's keeping. Place the necromancers' remains within it, and he will be well protected for the journey.
Excellent work! Now your journey to Quelthalas can begin.

Dialogue/UndeadCampaign/Undead02/U02Uthe.transcription: Your father ruled this land for 70 years, and you've grounded a dust in a matter of days.
The urn holds your father's ashes, Arthas. What? We are hoping to piss on them one last time before you left his kingdom to rot?
I dearly hope that there's a special place in hell waiting for you, Arthas.

Dialogue/UndeadCampaign/Undead02Interlud.transcription: Is everything proceeding as planned ticondrious? Lord Archimonde demands a report on the scourge.
Our only concern is that this scourge accomplishes what it was created to do. Our command will have all our heads if we do not keep control of this situation.
See that they do not. Lord Archimonde has little patience for failure.
The human means nothing in the long run. Ne aso wouldn't dare undermine our efforts now.
The Lich King's young death knight has been performing well. Almost too well. I begin to wonder if Nazul has ulterior motives for his new champion.
Believe me, brother. Neither the Lich King nor his undead lackeys will jeopardize the Legion's return.

Dialogue/UndeadCampaign/Undead03A/U03AAr.transcription: Ah, the wondrous eternal quelthalass. I haven't been here since I was a boy.
The frail elves do not concern me, Necromancer. Our forces are strengthened with every foe we slay.
We shall see. Bring forth the prisoner.
Where is the entrance to your land, Elf?
It is you who should turn back Sylvanas. Death itself has come to your land.

Dialogue/UndeadCampaign/Undead03A/U03AEl.transcription: The undead are advancing. Alert the sentries.

Dialogue/UndeadCampaign/Undead03A/U03AKe.transcription: Be wary. The elves likely wait in ambush.
Don't be too over confident, Death Knight. The elves must not be taken lightly.
The energies of this place are strong. Kill the elves, level their structures. This location is perfect for your base.

Dialogue/UndeadCampaign/Undead03A/U03ANe.transcription: Lord Arthas, the creatures of the forest are also resisting our invasion.

Dialogue/UndeadCampaign/Undead03A/U03ASy.transcription: You are not welcome here. I am Sylvanas Windrunner, Ranger General of Silvermoon. I advise you to turn back now.

Dialogue/UndeadCampaign/Undead03B/U03BAr.transcription: Your precious gates will not stop me any more than these trees, little elf. Bring up the meat wagons. We'll make our own entrance.
Finally, we've reached the Elfgate. Press the attack, let none survive.
The Elfgate has fallen! Onward, my warriors! Onward to victory!

Dialogue/UndeadCampaign/Undead03B/U03BHi.transcription: It is the traitorous human prince! Run for your lives!

Dialogue/UndeadCampaign/Undead03B/U03BPr.transcription: You will never enter quelthalos, fallen prince. The woods themselves protect our borders, and the enchanted elf-gates protect our capital.

Dialogue/UndeadCampaign/Undead03B/U03BSy.transcription: Do your worst. The elf gate to the inner kingdom is protected by our most powerful enchantments. You shall not pass.
Summon the reinforcements! We must hold them back!
Shindofun! Fall back to the second gate. Fall back!

Dialogue/UndeadCampaign/Undead04A/U04AAr.transcription: You waste your time, woman. You cannot outrun the inevitable.
Damn that woman! We must find a way to cross the river.
The Ranger woman is starting to vex me greatly.
The second moon crystal is ours.
The crystal glows brightly, but there is no effect on a gate.
The gates have been opened. Once we've dealt with Sylvanas, the inner kingdom shall be ours.
I salute your bravery, Elf, but the chase is over.
After all, you've put me through a woman. The last thing I'll give you is the peace of death.

Dialogue/UndeadCampaign/Undead04A/U04AKe.transcription: She is persistent. Reminds me of you, Death Knight.
That lone crystal is a component of the key of the three moons. The other two crystals must be found if the elf gate is to be unlocked.
At last, the third moon crystal. The key of the three moons is complete.
As I said, you must find all three moon crystals for the key to be whole.

Dialogue/UndeadCampaign/Undead04A/U04ASy.transcription: You've won through this gate butcher, but you won't get through the second. The inner gate to Silvermoon can only be opened with a special key, and it shall never be yours.
Do you think that I'm running from you? Apparently you've never fought elves before.
Damn you monsters! What will it take to drive you back?
Then I'll make my stand here, butcher. Anarala Balari.
Finish it. I deserve a clean death.

Dialogue/UndeadCampaign/Undead04B/U04BAr.transcription: Fear not. The crypt fiends can force them to the ground.

Dialogue/UndeadCampaign/Undead04B/U04BNe.transcription: Lord Arthas, our forces cannot attack the flying beasts.

Dialogue/UndeadCampaign/Undead05A/U05AAr.transcription: I was wondering when you'd show up.
I will reach the Sunwell on my own, Dreadlord.
Do you think he suspects that you've been aiding me necromancer?
Then watch for her runners. None of them must get through.
The gargoyles we brought back from Northrend could be useful here. The beasts can spot their runners along the main road.

Citizens of Silvermoon, I have given you ample opportunities to surrender, but you have stubbornly refused. Know that today, your entire race and your ancient heritage will end. Death itself has come to claim the High Home of the Elves.
Now arise, Kel'Thuzad, and serve the Lich King once again.
I've upheld my end of the bargain litch. Are you ready to tell me about the dreadlords now?

Dialogue/UndeadCampaign/Undead05A/U05AKe.transcription: I'm sure he suspects quite a bit. It is his nature to assume the worst. Now steal yourself. The hour of my rebirth draws near.
I am reborn, as promised. The Lich King has granted me eternal life.
Certainly, but not here. They have eyes and ears everywhere. We'll talk where it's safe.

Dialogue/UndeadCampaign/Undead05A/U05ANe.transcription: Lord Arthas, the elf woman will likely attempt to summon reinforcements.
Lord Arthas, Sylvanas has sent a runner to Silvermoon. The elves are sure to send more forces at us.
Lord Arthas, Sylvanas has sent a runner to Silvermoon.
Sylvanas has sent out another runner. It must be stopped.
Lord Arthas, the messenger has reached the city. We should expect an attack soon.

Dialogue/UndeadCampaign/Undead05A/U05ASy.transcription: Did you forget about us, you wretches?

Dialogue/UndeadCampaign/Undead05A/U05ATi.transcription: You've done well so far, but the true task still lies before you.
I am here to ensure that you do your job, little human. Not do it for you.
It is a pool of mystical energy from which the elves draw their immortal powers. They will not give it up easily.

Dialogue/UndeadCampaign/Undead05BInterlu.transcription: So, you're not upset about me killing you that one time?
The Lich King knew that I would kill you?
If he's so all-knowing, then how can the dreadlords control him like they do?
So the Plague and Lordaeron, the citadels in Northrend, the slaughtering of the Elves, it was all just to prepare for some huge demonic invasion?
Don't be foolish. The Lich King told me how our encounter would end.
Of course, he chose you to be his champion long before the Scourge even began.
They are agents of the ones who created our Master, the fiery lords of the Burning Legion.

It is a vast, demonic army that has consumed countless worlds beyond our own. Now it comes to set this world to the flame. Our master was created to pave the way for its arrival. The dreadlords were sent to make sure that he succeeded.
Yes. In time, you will find that our entire history has been shaped by the coming conflict. Nor come, we have much work to do.

Dialogue/UndeadCampaign/Undead06/U06Arch.transcription: You called my name Juliich, and I have come. You are killed, Uzad. Are you not?
Very well then, there is a special tome you must find. The only remaining spell book of Medivh, The Last Guardian. Only his lost incantations are powerful enough to bring me into your world.
Seek out the mortal city of Dalaran. It is there that the tome is kept. At Twilight, three days from now, you will begin the summoning.

Dialogue/UndeadCampaign/Undead06/U06Arth.transcription: Isn't it time you told me about the second phase of the plan, Litch?
like the forces of Lordaeron and the high elves.
So where are we going now?
He dropped the large tome. Is it magical?
I've encountered these demon worshipping orcs before. How do they fit into all this?
The brutes have been slain. The demon gate is yours, litch.

Dialogue/UndeadCampaign/Undead06/U06Blad.transcription: We orcs are the true servants of the Burning Legion. These mindless undead are weak. Impure.

Dialogue/UndeadCampaign/Undead06/U06KelT.transcription: Certainly. The first phase of the Lich King's plan was to engineer the Scourge, which would eradicate any group that might resist the Legion's arrival.
Exactly. The second phase is to actually summon the demon lord who will spark the invasion.
There is a nearby encampment of black rock corks who maintain a functional demon gate. I must use the gate to commune with the demon lord and receive his instructions.
Your people failed their task savage. You too must be scourged from the world.
It is a tome of demon lore. No doubt his comrades carry it as well.
That, young one, is a very complicated matter. Suffice it to say they no longer hold any favor with a Legion.
Behold, the Frost Worm! These undead dragons are the Lich King's favorite pets. This one shall serve us well.
This camp guards the demon gate. Defeat these orcs quickly so that I can contact the demon lord.
I call upon the Archimonde. Your humble servant seeks an audience.
Yes, great one. I am the Summoner.
Where should we search for a great one?

Dialogue/UndeadCampaign/Undead06/U06OrcW.transcription: The Legion has sent the dead to test us! Victory to the Black Rock Clan!

Dialogue/UndeadCampaign/Undead07/U07Anto.transcription: Greetings, Prince Arthur's. How fair is your noble father?
We've prepared for your coming, Arthas. My brethren and I have erected auras that will destroy any undead that pass through them.
Pull your troops back, or we will be forced to unleash our full powers against you. Make your choice. Death Knight.
It pains me to even look at you, arthas.

Dialogue/UndeadCampaign/Undead07/U07Arth.transcription: Wizards of the Kirin Tor. I am Arthas, first of the Lich King's death knights. I demand that you open your gates and surrender to the might of the Scourge.
Lord Antonitis, there's no need to be snide.
Your petty magics will not stop me Antonitis.
I'll be happy to end your torment, old man. I told you that your magics could not stop me.
The spellbook is all yours, Litch. Let's take it and leave before the wizards amass for their final attack.

Dialogue/UndeadCampaign/Undead07/U07KelT.transcription: I sense that three separate wizards are maintaining these Auras. If you find and kill them, the Auras will disperse.
The Archmage has been killed. The First Aura is dispersing.
The Kirin Tor keeps these creatures caged for study. If they were to be released, they would cause our enemies a great deal of pain.
The second wizard has fallen, only one curses aura remains.
The wizards keep many enchanted items within that vault. Shatter it and we can turn our enemy's own weapons against them.
Indeed, I will begin summoning Lord Archimonde at sunset.

Dialogue/UndeadCampaign/Undead08/U08Arch.transcription: Cremble mortals and despair. Doom has come to this world.
You have done well, little litch. My plan worked perfectly.
Very well, Ticondrius. Since the Lich King is of no further use to me, you dreadlords will now command the Scourge.
Soon I will order the invasion to begin. But first, I will make an example of these paltry wizards by crushing their city into the ashes of history.

Dialogue/UndeadCampaign/Undead08/U08Arth.transcription: The circle of power has been prepared for your instructions, Litch. Are you ready to begin the summoning?
Defend health is odd at all costs. The summoning must not be disrupted.
Hold your ground, Keltazod must be defended. This is the hour of our victory.
Excellent. We will make good use of them.
This has got to be a joke. What happens to us now?

Dialogue/UndeadCampaign/Undead08/U08KelT.transcription: Nearly. I've been reading through Medive's spell book. His knowledge of demons alone is staggering. I suspect that he was far more powerful than anyone ever realized.
The Legion's fury scorches the sky. The barriers between the worlds are weakening.
The Legion has sent Hellhounds to aid us. The beasts are yours to command Death Knight.
At last, the mighty infernals have been sent to aid us, rather than quickly death-night, they are yours to command.
Come forth, Lord again, and enter this world, and let us bask in your power!
Be patient young Death Knight, the Lich King foresaw this as well. You may yet have a part to play in his grand design.

Dialogue/UndeadCampaign/Undead08/U08Necr.transcription: Lord Arthas, our scouts have found a cache of goblin landmines.

Dialogue/UndeadCampaign/Undead08/U08Tich.transcription: Not powerful enough to escape death, that is for certain. Suffice to say, the work he began, we will finish today. Let the summoning commence.
Lord Archimonde, all the preparations have been made.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead01x/L01Arth.transcription: Greetings, dreadlords! I should thank you for looking after my kingdom during my absence. However, I won't be requiring your services any longer.
Not anymore, demon. Your masters have been defeated. The Legion is undone. Your deaths will complete the circle.
I have returned, Litch, but you will now address me as king. This is after all my land.
Now we must secure the kingdom by scouring the last remnants of humanity from it.
Then we must slaughter them before they escape. Their deaths will be a fitting tribute to Nazul.
I can't believe any of you survived the first purge. No matter. After today, your self-righteous order will cease to exist.
The pain is unbearable. What is happening to me?
No, the pain is passed, but my powers are diminished. Something is terribly wrong here.
No, I will finish the hunt. We'll solve this mystery once our business is done.
Then we've failed, Litch. Return to the capital. Someone will pay dearly for this.
At last, the alliance is finished. Once we round up the last stragglers, we should be...
Take me back to the capital. I have a long journey ahead of me.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead01x/L01Baln.transcription: We were charged with overseeing this land, Deathrock. It is our duty to remain here and ensure that the scourge is ready for action.
This land is ours. The scourge belongs to the Legion.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead01x/L01Deth.transcription: It's been months since we last heard from Lord Archimonde. I grow tired of watching over these rotting undead. What are we still doing here?

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead01x/L01KelT.transcription: Impossible to say, but the longer they remain in command, the more they run the scourge into the ground.
We knew you would return to us, Prince Arthas.
But my king, the humans have begun to abandon their villages.
They are fleeing to the canyon passes. If they escape into the mountains, it will be impossible to hunt them all down.
King Arthas, do you need assistance?
The humans are nearing the past, stop them!
We cannot allow the humans to escape.
Stop them before they reach the past!
slaughter the humans before they escape
King Arthas, the humans have made it through the past. Now there's no way to stop them from reaching sanctuary.
My King, you are not well.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead01x/L01Lich.transcription: Danger draws here. Power is waiting. Time is running out.
It is high. The next king. Danger draws near the frozen throne. You must return to Northrend immediately. Oh hey!

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead01x/L01Pala.transcription: "Arthas, you wear your father's crown as if you earned it. You may kill me, but my brethren will never stop hounding you."
"Come, traitor, and taste the wrath of the Holy Light!"
We will never abandon Lordaeron, Arthas. We will never give up.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead01x/L01Sylv.transcription: The leading was defeated months ago. How could they not know?
Another human has made it through the past.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead01x/L01Vari.transcription: True, though we should have received some kind of orders by now.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead01xInterlud.transcription: Lady Sylvanas, we are pleased that you came.
Though his rune blade Frostborn carries powerful enchantments, Arthur's own powers will fade in time. It is inevitable.
The Lich Kalthazar is far too loyal to portray his master. But you, on the other hand...
I, for one, do not trust her. Her heart is still elven. She will never side with us.
The Legion may be defeated, but we are the Naphrazeem. We'll not let some upstart human get the best of us. Arthas must fall.
Agreed. Well, if that settled, let the festivities commence.
How could I not? For some reason I no longer hear the Lich King's voice in my head. My will is my own once again.
You dread more soon to know why.
And what if King Arthas? What about his powers?
You seek to overthrow him, and you want my help to do it.
Hate him. I had my own reasons for seeking vengeance. Arthas murdered my people and turned me into this monstrosity.
I may take part in your bloody coup, but I will do so in my own way.
We've discovered that the Lich King is losing his power. As it wanes, so too does his ability to command undead such as you.
Don't be too hasty. She has great spirit, but her hatred for Arthas will ultimately serve our cause.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead02x/L02Abom.transcription: Small king nor steppe! Say, rem feast!

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead02x/L02Arth.transcription: Yes, with my powers drained, I can barely command my own warriors. The Lich King warned me that if I didn't reach Northrend soon, all could be lost.
Very good. We'll need to move quickly and find any others still loyal to me. We're going to need all the support we can get.
You there. Will you not stand by your king?
I call upon your loyalty. Will you serve me?
I have need of you warriors. Come with me.
These piles of corpses will serve us well. We can reanimate the bodies and bolster our forces as we move.
I have need of your abilities, little shade. Will you help me?
The dreadlords guards are stationed outside that armory. If we can fight our way past them, we could commandeer the meat wagons held inside.
Finally, some firepower. These will help us with the main gate's defenses.
You have my thanks, ladies. But where is your mistress? Where is Sylvanas?
We have no time for this. We must find our way out quickly.
I would not leave my subjects to be slaughtered by this rabble.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead02x/L02Baln.transcription: You should never have returned, human. Weakened as you are, we have assumed control over the majority of your warriors. It seems your reign was short-lived.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead02x/L02Bans.transcription: She sent us to find you, Great Killing. We've come to escort you across the river. Once we cross it, we'll take refuge in the wilderness.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead02x/L02Cryp.transcription: My noob. The rebels nearly had us, King Arthas.
Then we shall stand by you till the end.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead02x/L02Deth.transcription: There's been a change of plans keel authors. You're not going anywhere.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead02x/L02KelT.transcription: So the seizures have been getting worse?
Fear not, my king. Everything has been prepared for your departure. The ships are waiting at the coast, and...
There are too many of them, my King. Flea! Escape from the city! I'll find my own way out and meet you in the wilderness.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead02x/L02Necr.transcription: Our master kelthuzad sent us to aid you. Our new skeletal mages will make short work of the rebels.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead02x/L02Shad.transcription: I live only to serve you, King Arthas.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead02xInterlud.transcription: Why here? We've got to find Kelthazade before-
Traitor! What have you done to me?
You have been a loyal friend, Keltazan. I don't know what the future holds, or if I'll even return. But I want you to watch over this land. See to it that my legacy endures.
This is the Player Sisters. We'll rest here, Great Kid.
Back you mindless ones! You shall not fall today, my King!
The effect of her era will wear off in time. All the preparations for your journey to Northrend have been made.
I shall King Arthas. I shall.
You have been deceived. Come to my side once. Oh hey!
You walked right into this one, Ifus. It's time to even the scales.
It's a special poisoned arrow I made just for you. The paralysis you're experiencing now is but a fraction of the agony you've caused me.
A quick death? Like the one you gave me? No. You're going to suffer as I did. Thanks to my arrow. You can't even run.
Get my regards to hell, you son of a bitch.
This is an over-arthest. I'll never stop hunting you.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead03x/L03Bans.transcription: I don't understand, Mistress. I thought you'd be alright.
Our base is under attack. We must bolster our defenses.
Perhaps, mistress, but there are more of them out there. If we could lure them to a site, they would be a great help against their mothresses' forces.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead03x/L03MugT.transcription: Me warlord Muthar! Me crush weak dead!
Me said pretty ghost now. But those warriors said too.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead03x/L03Ogre.transcription: Pretty Ghost! Find enemies to kill!
Ogres no work for no dead.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead03x/L03Ring.transcription: Lady Sylvanas is master here. We fight for her, brothers.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead03x/L03Snar.transcription: Ugh, back you dead! No one trespasses on our territory!

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead03x/L03Sylv.transcription: Aren't you, sister? All the days ago, we were the Lich King's slaves. We existed only the slaughter in his name. And now... we are... free.
What joy is there in this curse? We are still undead, sister. Still monstrosities. What are we if not slaves to this torment?
They're in Mothras. My only interest was in seeing Arthas dead. I have no time for your petty politics or power mongering.
I lived as a slave long enough, Dreadlord. I won't relinquish my freedom by shackling myself to you fools.
Be ready. Bear my thrust will attack soon. With only our sister Banshees and a few ghouls to aid us, it will be difficult to fend him off.
Forest trolls. I hate they even more than those cursive dreadlords. Slaughter them all!
He's welcome to try, Savage.
These cars were hardly worth the effort.
How very clever of you, sister. Possessing these lowly creatures could turn the tide in our favor. We'll start with their leader. Once we have him, subverting his warriors will be child's play.
That brute must be Zulrog, the troll chieftain.
These ogres are exactly what we need to defeat if they're enough for us.
No? Perhaps we'll just ask your lord and see what he thinks about it.
I think not.
You are overzealous, my warriors. You destroyed him before we could lure him to our side.
Feel any better muckball?
Let's move out.
Those manging gnolls creep bolster our forces.
Will someone please steal his mind and be done with it?
They slimy retches could serve as well.
That ugly of told is the creature we seek. Once we claim his tiny mind, his minions will serve our cause.
You underestimated me, Dreadlord. Now you're going to pay here.
You're scheming "Brothers" can't help you now, there are more for us.
Come and face me, Dreadlord. Are you afraid?
You'll pay for all the suffering you've caused, Barry Malphras. I swear it.
Any final words, demon?
Just like a demon, you'd sell your brethren out just to save your own skin. I'm listening.
Alright there and Marthaas, I'll let you prove your loyalty to me, but be warned and keep me on a short leash.
These bandits will serve me well. Let's find their ringleader and steal his mind.
He may as well surrender now, Kritany. He'll be my slave, one way or another.
Damn. He never even had a chance to serve me.
Hmm. My own bound of assassins. Intriguing.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead03x/L03Trol.transcription: You'll never get us all, witch. Chief Dunzurag will hunt you down, and the vengeance.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead03x/L03Vari.transcription: Greetings, ladies of Anas. My brothers and I appreciate the role you played in overthrowing office. I've come to offer you a formal invitation to join our new order.
Careful, lady. It would be unwise to incur our wrath. We are the future of these plague lands. You can either join us and rule or be cast aside.
So be it. Our reply will come soon.
Foolish banshee. You think you can match the might of a dreadlord?
You should have joined the Sylvanas. Your refusal will cost you dearly.
Is that all you've got, Sylvanas? I expected more from you.
Come, little Archer. I'll reunite you with your slaughtered countrymen.
Sylvanas, spare my life. I beg you. I can be of service. I swear it.
I know what my brother's plans are. I know where their forces are based. Just let me serve you, and I'll help you defeat them.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead04x/L04Anub.transcription: Onward for the scourge, slay their menersel's name.
The Lich King sent me to aid you death knight. I am a new work. Ancient King of Azul Naurub.
There is a dragon that lives in the hills nearby. The creature may hold artifacts that could protect us on our march.
Most impressive. But you need to conserve your energy's death night. We have a long road ahead of us.

There is another route we might take death night. The ancient shattered kingdom of Azul-Nurub lies deep below us. Though it has fallen on dark times, it could provide us a direct shortcut to the glacier.
Nothing is certain death night. The ruins will be perilous, but it's worth the risk.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead04x/L04Arth.transcription: Northrend. It feels like a lifetime since I was last here.
Something out there is threatening the Lich King. We must reach Ice Crown quickly.
What the?
They look like high elves. What are they doing here?
Northrend belongs to the Scourge Elf. You made a terrible mistake by coming here. Slay them!
They must have a base around here somewhere.
seismic tremors. What tortures this land?
Another earthquake. This can't be good.
This does not bode well for the Lich King.
Snakemen, who the hell are they? I have never seen their like in Northrend before.
Who's up?
Thanks for the assistance, Mighty One.
I welcome your aid Anubarak, but we have little time for pleasantries. We must reach Icecrown immediately.
Sorry we don't have time to chat, Great Worm. We've come to murder you and steal whatever artifacts you've hoarded over the centuries.
*yawns*
My powers are weakening, but I'll be alright.
At least I still have enough power to do this.
These elves are pathetic. It's no wonder we destroyed their homeland so easily.
Prince Kaelthos. I haven't seen you since. You lead these elves?
Iliadon. He's behind this invasion?
He's right. We'll never reach the glacier in time.
We have little choice. Lead on a New Barak.
You're certain we can reach the glacier through these tunnels?
Alright, let's go.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead04x/L04Bloo.transcription: Prince Arthas, we are the blood elves. We have sworn to avenge the ghosts of Quelthalas. This dead land will be cleansed.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead04x/L04Kael.transcription: Pity I wasn't there to stop you. It's been a long time, Arthas.
This group at least, what you faced here was merely a scouting force. Defeating Lord Illidan Zhaime will be far more difficult.
He is. Our forces are vast, Arthas. Even now they march upon the ice-crown glacier. You'll never make it in time to save your precious Lich King.
Consider this payment for Quelvalaas and other insults.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead04x/L04Lich.transcription: Make haste, my enemies draw near our time with all the scent.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead04x/L04Necr.transcription: My King, we'll need to establish a base here first. But this island is nearly devoid of resources.
The earthquakes have shattered a glacial wall and revealed a new waterway. Perhaps our fleet can use this to our advantage.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead04x/L04Sapp.transcription: You dare enter my lair. I am Sapharon, ancient servant of Maligos the Spellburn. Explain yourselves.
Honesty. How refreshing. None may challenge Saffron and live.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead05x/L05Bans.transcription: Who do you sigh of human?

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead05x/L05Deth.transcription: Traitor, how could you betray us like this? We could have ruled this land together.
Come and face me little banshee.
You are clever Sylvanas, but you are no match for me.
You rebels rush headlong to your deaths.
I am Nathrazeem. My will cannot be denied.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead05x/L05Foot.transcription: The dark lady, I am hers to command.
Ah, who are we supposed to be fighting again?

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead05x/L05Gari.transcription: I am Garathos. I am sworn to defend the Master with my life.
slay the rebels before they regroup.
Hold the line, you dogs! Fight on!
The spell has been lifted. Is the nightmare finally over?
What is it you want, Elf Witch?
Why should we trust you? You're part of the scourge that drove us out in the first place.
Very well. I'll rally what's left of my forces and meet you outside the gates.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead05x/L05Necr.transcription: The Patrol has returned. Open the gates!
Slay the upstarts in Death Rock's name.
The Dark Lady is here! We must push her forces back!

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead05x/L05Sylv.transcription: You've done well there among us. You've led us straight to Death Rock stronghold. But tell me, who are those humans?
Your brother is more clever than I thought. His defenses are considerable.
I have no intention of assaulting the walls.
My banjays will possess those halfless humans. We'll use them to open the gates for us.
Of course. If we straight quickly enough, never I will never know what hit him.
Ready yourselves. The moment is upon us.
Now my warriors strike!
We can attack either of the two beges within unity, but it's only a matter of time before the other is alerted to our presence.
Deveroppel sent his forces soon. We must be ready.
The humans will send their forces soon. We must be ready.
You must be the human in command of this rebel.
The new poor, confused creature.
The human's destruction gives me a certain amount of satisfaction. But death or op is the true threat here. It's not over till he lies dead at my feet.
Strike fast, my warriors! Death or Rock must fall!
Spare no one. The dreadlord's forces must not escape.
Fight on my warriors, victory draws near!
Let none survive.
Stone down humans. I have no quarrel with you.
We have a common enemy. The last Dreadlord Balen as our currently controls the capital city of your kingdom. If you help me kill him, I'll see too it that you get your lands back.
Not anymore. My only interest here is vengeance.
Of course not. The humans are simply a means to an end.
Watch it, Fred Lord.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead05x/L05Vari.transcription: Death of Rock used his telepathy to enslave a top-ranking human warlord. I believe his name was Garibon or Gillethos or something. Human names all sound the same to me.
Instead of stamping it out, Deathrock has taken control of the last pocket of human resistance. They maintain their own army within the Keep.
Yes, and with this paltry force you've mustered, a direct assault on his walls would be suicide.
You realize we'll have only a short amount of time before he discovers what we're up to.
We must hurry. Time is running out.
We're out of time. Both bases have been alerted to our presence. We've got to bolster our defenses before they launch their counterattack.
Sylvanas has greater strength than you know, brother. I'll take my chances with her.
Come now, you have no intention of giving them their lands back.
You sound more like one of us with every passing day, my lady.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead06x/L06Baln.transcription: You vile traitors will suffer for this outrage.
You will all drown in lakes of blood.
My power supreme. You Mongrels cannot win.
Now, feel the wrath of the Legion.
Come, you burning devils, boundless are calls.
Heed me demons. Devour these traitorous fools.
I still have a hand to play.
You disappoint me, brother. Poor Death Rock must have been stung by your treachery. How dare you call yourself "Nathra-Zim"!
Oh, my wayward pet Garethos. I see you've grown a spine since we last met.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead06x/L06Bans.transcription: Mistress, we've discovered another storehouse. It may hold artifacts that could aid us.
Mr. Sylvanas, we found yet another storehouse. It likely holds priceless magical treasures.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead06x/L06Foot.transcription: Lord Gerathos, our scouts have found the missing band of dwarves. They appear to be lost in the wilderness nearby.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead06x/L06Gari.transcription: What's the matter, demon? Are you afraid?
An aggressive ploy, my lady. So long as we get our capital back, I'll stick to whatever strategy you wish.
Here they come boys! Stand your ground!
Cut them to shreds, for Lordaeron!
We're under attack! Defend the base at all costs!
Those brainless dwarves are almost more trouble than they're worth. However, we'll need them on the front lines. I'll have to lead them myself.
Can't you idiots follow simple orders? There's a war on and you louts are off having a picnic! Get this column rolling immediately!
Your mind powers tricked me before, Demon, but never again. You and I have a serious score to settle.
Forward, my warriors. We'll take backwards hours.
The enemy is advancing. We may need help here.
They're pressing the attack! We've got to hold the line!
Stand fast, my warriors! We're not out of this yet!
There, your business is done. Now I want you wretched animals out of my city before I...

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead06x/L06Rifl.transcription: Right away, Lord Garathos. Move them out, lads!
Oh, they don't pay us enough to put up that asshole.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead06x/L06Sylv.transcription: Stand down, gentlemen. Save your anger for Balnazzar. Garathos, I'll lead my forces in a frontal assault while you attack the city from the rear.
Give the order. Blood the attack commence.
Store houses such as this hold many of Laura's treasures, seek them out, and we'll claim whatever artifacts they hold.
Let's see. I've made one of your brothers my servant and tore the other to bloody shreds. I wonder what your fate holds down the czar.
Push the attack. Their defenses are weakening.
Where are you, Belnazar? Afraid to face me?
It's over, Belma's are. They're a mattress.
I require one last test of your loyalty, Dreadlord. Do it.
The capital city is ours, but we are no longer part of the scourge. From here on out, we shall be known as the Forsaken.
We will find our own path in this world, Dreadlord, and slaughter anyone who stands in our way.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead06x/L06Vari.transcription: The capital city is heavily defended. Balnazzar is no fool, my lady. This battle can be won only through attrition.
Watch your tongue, human dog. Your hollow bravado does not impress you.
Drive them back. We've got to push into the heart of the city.
Our base is under siege. Man the defences.
Strike for the Dark Lady for Sylvanas.
Victory draws near, hasten the attack.
Bound as our must be here somewhere.
But I... it is forbidden for one of the Nathrazeem to kill another. My defection was one thing, but this...

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead07Ax/L07AAn.transcription: I left many of my warriors at Icecrown before I came to find you Death Knight. They will hold the line for as long as they are able.
I've been wondering about that myself. Something must have driven them all off.
The Lich King's time is running short. We must hurry.
Many of us who fell during the War of the Spider were brought back to serve the Lich King. These warriors, however, never died. Foolishly, they still fight to liberate Naurub from the Scourge.
There are other passages through the labyrinth death night. We will find another way.
There must be a hidden passage somewhere. We know Rubyans were crafty engineers in our time.
This is an ancient Narubian hoarding cell. We kept most of our treasures hidden in chambers like this. The passage to the lower depths lies just beyond this room.
This treasure belongs to the Lich King, little creature. We servants shall take what we will.
If the dwarf story was true, there's no telling what awaits us in the darkness.
This stairwell leads into the heart of the old Narubian Empire. We must be cautious.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead07Ax/L07AAr.transcription: We've been walking for hours. We've got to quicken our pace. The Lich King is defenseless without us.
Tell me, where are all of your people? Shouldn't there be Neurubians around here, undead or otherwise?
We have no time for these games.
Well done, Mighty Saffaron. I wish we could take you with us, but the confines of the dark earth are no place for you.
These Narubians are your kin. Why are they hostile to us?
This place looks like an old storage silo. It's a dead end, New Barak.
Great. As long as we're here, we can take some of these items with us.
Gold. We should take this with us.
More gold. This might help us later.
More gold. Take all you can carry.
We'll take our chances dwarf. We're going through that door one way or another.
The air smells awful in here. Something doesn't feel right.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead07Ax/L07AAx.transcription: We did your rotting bastards! We've been watching you all along!
We've been wondering this forsaken land ever since you killed Maradin and left us to a rat at us. Our leader Bailgun led us into the ruined city to survive.
But there's no way we're letting you in.
This is for merit in your bastards!
Kill 'em all twice, that's what I say!
Don't even try it, you bastard! That their traitor belongs to the dwarves!

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead07Ax/L07ABa.transcription: I remember you, evil prince. You're the one that killed poor Muradin.
I won't let you through this door, traitor. The recent quicks have awakened dark things under the ice. Ancient, horrid things. We vow to keep them locked where they are.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead07Ax/L07ARi.transcription: A pint for every goo you blast!
Shoot anything that shuffles or scatters!
Send off the charges! Blow the bridge before they get across!
That was for Muradin! Now you'll never get across!

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead07Bx/L07BAn.transcription: We have entered the Old Kingdom. Beware death night. Whatever scared the dwarves still lurks down here somewhere.
Wait, the towers on either side are rigged to fire bolts of frost. This hallway is a death trap.
The circular hatch in the far wall is an aqueduct plug. If we can open it, the water might flood the firing mechanisms and disable the entire trap.
He is referring to me, Death Knight. These Naurubians will stop at nothing to destroy us.
The eggs of our young are intubated within those breeding pods. There's no telling how many vicious hatchlings they hold.
We could also seal the doors to shut the hatchlings in.
They are the horrors the dwarves spoke of. I thought they were only legends.
A forgotten one. Look to your defenses death knights. Fight as you've never fought before.
We cannot take them all! Hurry death knight! Up the stairwell! Hurry!

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead07Bx/L07BAr.transcription: The Guardians are activating. Defend yourselves.
Gold. We should take this with us.
You were right. They're definitely hostile. We've got to destroy the breeding pods.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead07Bx/L07BCr.transcription: Thank you, great one. The rebel spiders captured my comrades as well. They're being held in a nearby chamber. Release them, and they will be yours to command.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead07Bx/L07BNe.transcription: Drive the foul undead back to the surface.
Death to the servants of Nazul!

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead07Cx/L07CAn.transcription: Not far. We have entered the Upper Kingdom. The exit should lead us to the base of the glacier itself. However, there are still hidden traps and pitfalls to account for.
We're running out of time. We must find the exit.
Another earthquake. We must hurry death night.
I see now why the Lich King chose you as his champion death knight. Few men could have survived this labyrinth alone.
They're blocking the way to the exits. We don't have to find our way through them to reach it.
Now quickly, head through that door. The exit to the surface lies just beyond.
Remember, Illidan and the true battle still await us in the world above. Hopefully our trek through the dark earth bought us the precious time we needed.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead07Cx/L07CAr.transcription: We're running out of time, Anuborak. How far are we from the exit?
Time is running out. Where is that damn exit?
This whole place is crumbling. We've got to move fast.
More gold. This might help us later.
I'll need this gold for when I reach the glacier.
The entire passage collapsed. There's no time to dig through this. I'll have to move quickly and find my own way out. Hopefully a new Barak and the others survived.
More of the Narubians' blasted mechanisms. I'll have to time this perfectly.
I'll be singed if I get too close to those flames.
I must find a way across this strange obstacle.
A new brack. You made it.
It'll be good to see the sun again.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead07CxInterlu.transcription: We've made it a new Brack. Our forces are already assembled and waiting.
I saw another vision of the Lich King. He has restored my powers. I know now what I must do. It's time to end the game once and for all.
I've decided. You have come at last.
There is a fracture in my prison, the frozen throne, and my energies are seeping from it. That is why your powers have diminished.
The real great Frostborn was once locked inside the throne as well. I thrust this from the ice, so that it would find its way to you, and then lead you to me to me.
From now, we face a grave danger. My creator, the demon lord Kil'jaeden, sent his agent here to destroy me.
If they should reach the frozen chrome before you, all will be lost. The stairs will be undanguined. I'll hurry. I will grant you all the power I can share.
Greetings, King Arthas. You've arrived just in time. Illidan's Naga and Blood Elf forces have taken up positions at the base of the glacier and...

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead08x/L08Anub.transcription: The throne chamber lies within the frozen peak at the center of the valley. It can only be opened by activating the four enchanted obelisks that surround it.
Illidan's forces have already entrenched themselves near two of them.
We'll need to drive them back and reactivate the umbrellas ourselves.
The obelisk is now active and under our control. However, Illidan will likely try to take it from us. We must defend this point at all costs.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead08x/L08Arth.transcription: Time's running out of New Barak. We've got to get inside the throne chamber before Illidan does.
Illidan has mocked the scourge long enough. It's time we put the fear of death back in him.
I've reached the first obelisk. It will take me a few moments to activate it. I'll need protection while I work.
This obelisk has been activated. We've got to push on!
You look different, Illidan. I guess the skull of Goldand didn't agree with you.
Are you still upset that I stole Jaina from you, Kale?
The third obelisk has been activated. Only one more remains. Rise up, my warriors!
We've done it in Ubarak. The throne chamber is open. This is the hour of the scourge.
The frozen throne is mine, demon. Step aside.
You are a piteous creature, Illidan. You don't even deserve an honorable death.
Leave this world and never return. If you do, I'll be waiting.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead08x/L08Illi.transcription: Then the hour has come at last. After today, the scourge will meet its end. Can you hear me out there, Arthas? Its end!
What's the matter, Arthas? Can't you hold one small patch of ground?
I've reactivated this obelisk. The Frozen Throne is nearly ours.
Foolish undead. This obelisk belongs to me.
You and your Lich King duped me once, but now I have the upper hand.
You're out of your legal king. You should have stayed hidden underground.
I've sworn to destroy it, Arthas! It must be done!

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead08x/L08Kael.transcription: Once the chamber is opened, we will destroy the frozen throne, as promised.
You've taken everything I've ever cared for, Arthas. Vengeance is all I have left.

Dialogue/UndeadExpCamp/Undead08x/L08Lady.transcription: We're sorry to interrupt your meditation master, but all our forces are in place.
